Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: First, the service is horrible.  My friends and I had just arrived in Vegas and were tired from our early flight.  We found America at 10:30am and wanted to eat.  The hostess said that it was currently breakfast so we could not sit for lunch.  She told us to wait at the bar and she would come get us around 11.  She never did and we kept staring at her, but she wouldn't seat us.  Finally, we got up waited in line and she gave us a table!  I ordered the nachos and the veggie burger.  They were bland and not what we expected from a restaurant in Vegas.  The service was equally poor.  I asked for mayo and never got it because we had about 4 waiters.

Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Came down for dessert. Took us nearly 20 minutes to get a slice of cheesecake and a bowl of ice cream. Unbelievably slow service. The 2 servers were completely overwhelmed. Where was management? They should have been helping. Food wasn't bad and decor is cool.  Bad service seems to be a theme throughout the New York New York.

Reviews.Author: Nichole
Reviews.Content: I ended up TWICE here in one night and didn't particularly like either experience, BUT was forced to come here because of one thing:  Every other restaurant in NY NY stops serving food late and I needed a snack (then my friends met me and needed some sustenance too) so my option was America orrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr America.  So America it was.  The service late at night is awful, the bar drinks take FOR EV ER (and cost too much), the prices are crazy high for the quality of the food, and the overall vibe is kind of sucky too.  Everywhere else in NY NY has such a nice vibe (or at least A vibe), but America has a Denny's with a gargantuan map one.  It's a shame I spent so much money here.  In retrospect, I would've told my friends to suck it up and walk across the street to MGM to get something instead.  Now I know.

Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Pretty good. Nothing to shout about. Alright breakfast but it's not a restaurant you'd be clamouring for. It's decent

Reviews.Author: Aj
Reviews.Content: This is where I eat Breakfast every morning when I'm in Las Vegas. Good prices and good food. I just grab some eggs and bacon since I'm gluten free and don't eat the toast. Had good service here when I was dining with friends, but when eating alone at the bar, the bar tender upgraded my order to something I didn't want and tried to charge me more for it. I turned away the extra food (containing gluten) and ate only what I ordered. (I know there is nothing about this place that says gluten free, but I'm willing to take a risk on bacon and eggs).

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Awesome service on a Sunday morning.  Food is slightly above average coffee shop type fare.  The theme has seen better days but for a quick bite, it's fine.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Cronut?! Yes please. Walked the strip for the first time in who knows how long and ended up at NY NY so some peeps could ride the roller coaster. As I was aimlessly walking around I remembered that there was a donut spot at NYNY I heard about and they had cronuts. Staff - one of them was clueless but luckily another came and rescued her. How hard of a question is,  which donut do I need to try?  You should have a favorite and if you don't you should have one that you can pretend is your favorite to answer questions just like that. I pretty much knew I was going to try a cronut but thought it was worth asking in case she was like  OMG you have to try this one.  Cronut - this looked more like the original cronut than the one i had at PB Doughnuts. It was really good. I thoroughly enjoyed it but it still felt like it was missing something. I guess I'll never know until I try the original. Maybe this was a dead ringer but in that case I would wonder what the craze was all about. Anyway, didn't eat anything else here but awesome little selection of donuts and I'll probably be back when I decide to go back to NYNY sometime.

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Umerica.  You see, when it comes to eating the day after a long night of drinking, there's not much you can do to fuck it up.  Unless of course you're  dining   at New York, New York's very own bland-a-tron.  America, is a veritable cornucopia of bad food, cheesy decor and, get this, surprisingly good service.  Yeah, go figure.   There were 8 of us eating and the majority of us all had something to say about the pathetic dishes that were brought out.  My BLT looked like it was made with bread from the local 99 cent store.  My friend Ian, who also ordered the BLT and fries, received 7 french fries on his plate.  Yes, 7.  Needless to say, we complained and got the rest of the missing fries to join his sandwich.  While the collective moans and groans at the table regarding the food were many, I found our waitress, Sigi, to be on top of her game.  It was almost as though she had a sixth sense regarding everything at the table.  Whether it was when we were placing the order or needing a refill, there she was, Joanna on the spot.  But , regardless of how good Sigi was, service only gets you so far.  So, when you're taking a break between between betting on black and rolling those dice, think twice about getting something to eat at America...it's a definite gamble.  See, what I did there?

Reviews.Author: K.
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were  greeted  by the hostess to the moment we left, this place sucked.  Needing a breakfast fix, wifey and I strolled up, after noticing that the room was at least 3/4 empty.   Figuring that this place was a safe bet, we sat down for a quick bite. Shortly after we were seated, we saw that the NBA finals were on, but with no sound, and he big 'ol closed caption lines over the scoreboard.  So, we asked the waiter upon taking our orders to make them to go - we would be watching the game in our room.  Our order - breakfast burrito and pancakes - took 25 goddam minutes. Even after the wait, being in generally good spirits, we were only mildly annoyed. All we had to do now was pay the bill and get out.  However, that sentiment quickly turned, considering that after we received the food, our waiter didn't come back with the check.   5 minutes pass... As I'm getting up to walk out with my free food, my wife grabs what appeared to be a manager, and asked him for our check. He brings the check, we provide our card, and he, too, decides not to come back. WTF?  I ended up walking the check to the front so the manager could complete the transaction... then guess who decides to show up? The stupid goddam waiter! How've ya been, bud?  He approaches me as I'm walking back to our table and says,  Is everything okay?   No, prick. I'm missing the finals.  To wrap it all up, the meal we had in our room was indicative on the  wish it were mediocre  service. Dry breakfast burrito, and pancakes that were crispy like waffles on the edges.   So yeah, this place sucks. If do come back, I'll be totally hammered so I can vomit on the tables after I eat.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I have been to this place many, many times but this is my first review.  This is a great place when you want food quickly and don't want to wait for a reservation at the many other dining options inside the casino.  America has the look and feel of a traditional diner. I love coming in here for breakfast.  They recently re-did their corn beef hash and eggs dish and it was very good.  Overall, for great value and good service you really can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: Food was okay but nothing great, Service was kind of slow, I think New New York has to step it up a notch in order to get the quality in great standing since Vegas is known for outstanding food and service!!!

Reviews.Author: Darrell
Reviews.Content: Every casino has a coffee shop/cafe, and this is NY NY's place.  A big restaurant and so far, I usually don't wait long to get a seat, unlike most of the other places.  I thought this is a bad sign, but was pleasantly surprised.  Nothing memorable here or to write home about, but the food is good and the menu is very adequate.  I would come back.

Reviews.Author: Ami
Reviews.Content: Average fair. Expensive prices. Should have stayed in the room for the room service. I wonder if the same place makes both?? They dont have ALASKA and HAWAII on their world 3D map!! Or i missed it?  Where did they put it.  If they dont have it, its messed up.

Reviews.Author: Conetha
Reviews.Content: My family and I had breakfast here one morning around 10am. It was pretty busy being around the holidays, but the wait was only about 10 minutes or so. All of the employees were really friendly and helpful. We had an 8 yr old in our group and he loved the giant map of America. Both him and my sister ordered lemonade which came with little flag toothpicks on the lemon (so cute!) I ordered the breakfast burrito which was pretty good and super filling. We all enjoyed our meals. Chocolate chip pancakes and bagel breakfast sandwich were also really good. You MUST stop at the doughnut counter and get the croissant donut with honey. OMG its amazing.

Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: my husband had an omelette that was good. i had a blt, a little on the small side for $10, but bacon was great. Our server was awesome!

Reviews.Author: Kacie
Reviews.Content: Our meal was mediocre at best. The steak was cooked well and not bad for the price considering it's Vegas but half of our party ate chicken dishes and ended up sick. We did not have food poisoning but the food did not sit well. To top it off the chicken Picata was terrible! A lemon flavor in a dish should be light, this tasted like the pasta was cooked in concentrated lemon juice... terrible! We told the server and she quickly brushed it off then ran off to get the check. She impatiently kept checking back for the bill while we finished our drinks. We will not be returning. Ever.

Reviews.Author: Erika
Reviews.Content: So, it's 4 a.m. and you're drunk and stuck inside the New York, New York Hotel. You're a 15.00+ cab ride away from your hotel down the strip and you have no cash, your friends are borderline vomits, you're wearing a $500 dress that's sopping wet from a naked hot tub party that seems like a distant memory (wait, naked? how was my dress wet?) and the only thing that's going to keep you alive is a cup of coffee and some buttered toast. Where do you go? You go to America, the only restaurant that will cater to your busted, drunk ass.   We ordered sausage, eggs and toast, a pot of coffee, chicken fingers and nachos. Someway or another, the grand total of the bill was $60, not  including tip. This is for crap I probably could have bought at 7-11 for $10.00 or less for the same quality. I guess when you're drunk and rambling, you have to pay extra for someone to try to decipher the shit coming out of your mouth.   The service here is terrible. It's because the people who work here hate their lives and it's evident in their lack of facial expression. Some may be suicidal, I mean, if I was working there at 4 am trying to talk to drunk people who have no idea what they're doing or saying, I'd probably think off-ing myself would be a good idea, too.   The only thing worth mentioning is that fucking gigantic map of the US. I've been to America a bunch of times, the most recent time being the basis of my review - but that shit is funny when you're sober, when you're drunk, when you're high, and I'm sure if I ever did shrooms or any sort of hallucinogen, I would want to come here and just stare at it.   So what I'm trying to say is, don't come here for the food - you come here when you've hit rock bottom with your partying and you need to chill the fuck out with some really greasy, crappy food. Expect to pay a fortune for food that some dog probably shit out a few hours earlier. That's all I really have to say.

Reviews.Author: Valerie
Reviews.Content: The food was pretty good but it was a bit overpriced. Banana pancakes are delicious!

Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: Came to America following a 4 hour road trip and were still too early to check into our hotel. Luckily, it is literally right next to the check in desk, so we didn't have to stray too far.  We were drawn in by their fabulous display of donuts and desserts. After seeing that a no frills cake donut was $2.50, I decided against just dessert. The place was pretty dead at 3pm. There's a huge 3D map of the US with different landmarks, which I thought was pretty cool to look at.  I was definitely hungry so I ordered some spicy wings. The wings were a little too bready for me and they had a weird after taste. Not great.  The husband ordered the brownie sundae which was ginormous! 'Murica! The vanilla ice cream tasted like some generic drug store brand, which was off putting. You know how sometimes you don't eat ice cream out of the carton for a long time and there's that thick chewy bit at the top? That's what it tasted like. Besides that, the brownie tasted moist without being mushy.   The server at the bar was super nice and friendly.   FYI...there aren't any restrooms inside the restaurant, so you'll have to take a short walk in the casino to do your business.

Reviews.Author: Bianca
Reviews.Content: The servings here are generous, the place is clean and the staff were attentive.  That's about all I got.  The food was pretty so-so. I ate here a few times during my stay and nothing wowed me. In fact, I sent back one of their  freshly made  donuts (that are sitting out all day and not behind a case or under glass to be kept fresh) because it was probably the worst doughnut I'd ever had--dry, flavorless and just YUCK.  I ordered a fruit salad with cottage cheese for breakfast one day and it was really good--the fruit was fresh and everything tasted good. The next day I ordered the same thing and the fruit looked markedly different--wilted, definitely not as fresh and the cottage cheese tasted  off .  I wouldn't waste my time ordering coffee here, so I got a latte made at Il Fornaio next door. Though they take a while and the line gets long, the coffee there looked much better than the coffee shop variety here.   Rather expensive for the quality, but they do serve you a hearty portion.   I probably wouldn't have been back as many times as I was if I wasn't staying here and they serve breakfast foods all day, as opposed to Il Fornaio which stops serving breakfast at 10:30.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I liked the ambience of the place very reasonable. They  had broccoli & cheese AND Chili fries for $4.50 as sides yum. I have to try this place again and again. Very Americana.  I'd say this place is one dollar sign to me, it was over $10 a person. Great service.

Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: Service was slow and it took forever for our food to come out. When we did get our food the Eggs Benedict and hash browns were cold. I ordered the Lox and bagel and had to put the sandwich together.   The map of the United States was cool and the donuts looked good.

Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I have a soft spot in my heart for America. This place has been in NYNY since it opened. It's a good option for a quick basic meal. Food quality is mediocre but the servic3 is always good. For the prices, i call it a fair deal. Go in with those expectations and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Mace
Reviews.Content: 6/20/16.  No photos.  Just a honest review of the food because that is what matters.  We came here because it was convenient so we would not brave the heatwave, over a 100 degrees and it was only 830am.  My friend sent his eggs back because they were cold.  I finished my simple breakfast of warm eggs and potatoes.  The first round of coffee was luke warm but the refill was hot.  My other friends steak was flavorless.  For 5 of us and a bill of $136.00 they should have refilled our water glasses.  Do yourselves a favor...stay away!  There are plenty of better restaurants in Vegas...even the low rated Denny's is better.

Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer Alert:  This review is just on their donuts, not the main restuarant. That being said, by the looks of their menu, there's an extensive line of breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Prices look decent, especially since America is inside a casino.  We arrived around 7:30 AM and there wasn't much of a line.  So, I'm sure we'll be back one day for some real food.   As for my review...it's all about their donuts. I tried their maple bar with chocolate drizzle and some of their cronuts.  The maple bar wasn't as good as it looks.  The donut wasn't fresh, it was lacking any flavor, and for about $3, way to expensive.  However, I think America's has some of best cronuts that I've had in Las Vegas. I have my favorite out there, but America had a unique taste to their's.  Their cronuts were layered with the outside of each layer having a crunchiness to them.  It was moist inside each layer and as you get closer to the center of this hybrid donut, it's even softer.  There's a uniquie citrus taste to these cronuts which appeals to me.  America may have bad maple bars, but sure made a huge comeback with delicious cronuts.   PS:  Additional photos of America's cronuts can be found here.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/donut-crawl-ii-las-vegas?select=IWJfpUAAiQK3e4zSSwB2Wg#IWJfpUAAiQK3e4zSSwB2Wg   YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE - (057/366)

Reviews.Author: Manny
Reviews.Content: It's ok for good ole American breakfast my buddy got sick off the chorizo plate

Reviews.Author: Reazor
Reviews.Content: Always excellent food and service! Ramon memorized my order perfectly! Thanks, Ramon!

Reviews.Author: Karey
Reviews.Content: Solid place for breakfast inside New York New York Casino & Hotel, near the front desk.  I had the nutella banana pancakes, side of hashbrowns, and a hot pumpkin spice coffee alcoholic drink which was lovely!  Good for a hearty meal before taking on another day in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: I am very sad that I agreed to eat here.  The food was barely palatable and my drink came out COMPLETELY wrong twice.  Service was acceptable, but in the end we paid $40 for the pleasure of crappy food and a generally bad dining experience.  Blegh.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I was reading some of the other review, I honestly do not who severed them or what kind of food they received, but my experience was much different.  My service asked if I wanted something to drink within a few minutes of me sitting down to the table, she was friendly and helpful. She let me know what kind of drinks they had, of course ice tea was perfect for me, within the time she needed to get my drink I was able to look at the menu and decide what I wanted to eat, I decided on then chicken fried steak, I figured it would be hard to mess that one up.    During the time I had placed my order my server made sure I had refills and asked if she could bring me anything, I did not need anything, but I did have a question on the huge map on the ceiling and what was some of the items on the map, she did not know, but it was fun talking about what it could be.    When my food arrived, it was fresh, hot and tasty.  I know the food it not 5 stars Restarurant quality, but I was very happy with my meal, and the cost of the meal was reasonable for what I had.  If you are looking for good food without breaking the bank (guessing that is what the casino is for) then this is a good place to eat a good meal.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: .strolling through the Casinos,  America  caught our eye and decided to have Sunday breakfast.  I wanted to order a healthy meal so I chose the  eqq-white omelet with the vegetable fritatta .  The omelet was fried in oil, but it wasn't greasy.  Serving size was medium (I estimate 3 eggs worth + 1 ounce of veggies).  My meal, to say the least was not memorable, and left me a bit hungry.  So I was glad that my meal came with a bowl of diced fruit.  Servers seemed so rushed, but apologetic for being harry. I really felt so rushed and that they just couldn't wait to turn the table. Put it this way, they practically started clearing the table before I was through with my fruit bowl.  So much so that, when I lifted my arm to take a serving of fruit from the bowl, that by time my fork hit the dish, they had wisked away the fruit bowl and my fork ended up scooping air from the table.  After receiving the check, they immediately took the canteen of coffee away.  I guess that was our cue to leave.  On the way out, with our check in hand and headed to the register, we decided to admire the globe on the ceiling (which was the restaurant main feature and what drew us in). After gazing upwards for 20 seconds, the hostess snapped the check from our hand and said,  i'll just ring you and if you can follow me, you can sign your bill .     Price for food/experience was not good.  My small meal + coffee + iced tea came to about 35 bux.  I would definitely NOT return and also NOT recommend to friends! There are better places to blow your money on.

Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I'm going to say the pluses of this place are the super cool map of the US.  I can never stop looking at it when i'm there, and the fact that it's 24 hours.  Other than that....the food is not great, and although the service is friendly, i kinda think they forget sometimes there are customers.  Only go for late night or desperate eating.

Reviews.Author: Juliana
Reviews.Content: Great food and atmosphere! But what made our dinner tonight so special was our wonderful waitor Neverly! He was so professional and kind and took perfect care of us. He has such a pleasant personality and we really enjoyed being taken care of by him. He is truly a great employee, this restaurant is lucky to have him. Thank you Neverly!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: We always stay center strip but still constantly find ourselves walking to NYNY just to eat at America.  This last trip to Vegas we ate there 3 times.  Their food is amazing and their deserts are also top notch.  The service is always great but we have to give props to the server we had on Friday 2/21/2014, her name is Novak and she provided excellent service with a genuine smile!  We Highly recommend this restaurant when you are in Vegas!!

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: Came here because we still had credit we HAD to use towards dinning. It was use it of Loose it. Oh how I wish we lost it.  Walking in, you get the feel of Denny's meets Marie Calendars, meets Carrows.   I ordered the Eggs Benedict, BF ordered an omelet, safe right?   Omelet arrived, looked like a normal omelet Eggs Benedict - hmm, hollandaise sauce was topped over the egg, but why did it not drizzle even a little down the egg? And what's this black stuff on the muffin, wait, they burned the muffin?! Can't be too bad since only ONE side was burnt. OK, I have this rule of taking back food, I TRY NOT to. I took one bite and seriously, all I tasted was the burnt of the toast. OK, take 2, can I get this fixed?   Take 2- Manager comes out to apologize for the order. OK, muffin not burnt, but only a the tips of the crust seem to be a little charred. Bite- why is this muffin not toasted? hollandaise sauce was thick and gewey, tasted a bit mushy. Egg was a bit overcooked and hash browns were mushy on the outside. No amount of Ketchup could save them. Only hate 1/2 of one muffin.  BF said his omelet was OK, but I guess his stomach didn't give the same reaction and suffered for 2 days after.  Service was sub par. At least my meal was  comped.

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Service was very fast contrary to what people have been experiencing on Yelp. I came here for the first time during dinner and had their 14 oz steak. Was incredibly delicious and the price was just right around $14. My girlfriend had the Spaghetti and Meatballs. She loved it so much we actually came back a second time to dine here. I couldn't believe how attentive the waiters were during dinner. They must have came by like 5 times to check on us. Bonus points for the waiters.   I believe we dined here 4 times during the course of our stay at New York New York. Twice for breakfast, once for lunch and dinner. The second time around I wasn't too impressed with the Philly Cheesesteak special. The bread felt very soggy and that ruined the taste.  For Breakfast, I had the New York State of Mind which is your traditional bacon, eggs, white toast with a side of fries. Their bacon strips are huge and I absolutely loved it. However they charged $5 for Orange Juice which I was not very pleased to see when the bill arrived. Very very overpriced for Orange Juice. Shame on you, 1 star off for trying to gouge the customer.  Moderately priced for all the other items on the menu and I would recommend giving this place a shot if you are looking for something traditional that you would find at most American diners like Dennys or IHOP.

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: WORST food I've had in a long time!! I would have never known about this place had it not been for a birthday dinner party for friends staying at NYNY. My friend and I split 2 meals, 4 cheese pizza and rueben wrap. The pizza was HORRIBLE! The worst pizza I've ever had, including frozen microwaveable pizzas and that's exactly what it was like. I could tell just by the look of it that it was not going to be good but then I took a bite. Cold, chewy spongy soft dough, the only thing fresh on the pizza was the parsley. I'm not exaggerating it was the worst meal, I'd rather have a happy meal at McDonalds! The Rueben wrap wasn't much better, rubbery fatty meat, smothered in sauce. It was bad but not as bad as the pizza. Save yourself the money and and frustration and don't eat here!

Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Perfect for the price! All the american favorites are on the menu. I liked that the environment, food, and service were a step above the average cafe. Not too snooty but not at all divey.  My steak was cooked perfectly and the rest of the food was amazing for a 3:00 am meal. The decor is wonderful and keeps the eyes entertained during the entire visit. The doughnut bar is wonderful and has excellent selections. They stay open 24 hours but the food taste much better than any 24 hour place I've been. Not to mention that in Vegas 24 hour spots are required knowledge. I've been twice and in both experiences the waitresses were excellent and patient.  Bonus:This cafe serves alcohol!  THE BAD: American food can be found a little cheaper elsewhere.  It's in a Hotel Casino and that may not suit all families. This also means you can't park out front so you'll have to walk from the hotel parking structure waaaay out back. They allow smoking indoors in Las Vegas. (I guess for some that could be good or bad).  ALL IN ALL:  I rated this place with 5 stars because to me it is the ultimate cafe in Vegas. It is above cafe scale in its entirety including the 24 hour service, on strip location, great hotel, great service, and great tasting food. I consider it a MUST for the Vegas traveler.

Reviews.Author: Average
Reviews.Content: 24 hour good shit.  Rib-eye...at 3am...and the shit ain't expensive. Plus there is some giant mock-up of....guess...AMERICA up in there. Sit at the bar and random people may start talking to you, as well as possible prostitutes. I was in there once and two prostitutes were having a crazy ass argument and then one said  Do you know what you pu**y smells like?  and I'm over here trying to eat a tasty assed omelette...AND I'M NOT EVEN MAKING THIS UP! Staff is super friendly, customers are friendly as well and kinda cute for a late night eatery. If you're at the south end of the strip roll up in there and get you some good stuff.

Reviews.Author: Rae
Reviews.Content: Like a few of the other Yelpers,  I was surprised this restaurant did not have higher ratings.  I noticed many of the unhappy Yelpers  complained about the breakfast service and food, so that may be why our experience was much better since we went during dinner on a weekday night.  Our server was Tha and he was very professional and made sure we were taken care of.  They had a kids menu complete with crayons which made our son very happy.  He brought out juice in a kids cup also which was a plus since we were inside a casino and have not found many places that catered to children during this trip.  The large 2-D map on the ceiling captured his interest for a long while too.  We ordered the kids cheeseburger and fries for our son, which came on a wheat bun and served with potato wedges.  The bf ordered a patty melt and fries.  I had the catch of the day, very fresh grilled salmon in a chili glaze with seasoned rice and fresh sauteed vegetables.  I was hungry and the portion was a bit small, so a cup of soup or salad included probably would have satisfied me.  The cousins ordered nachos and the steak and crab leg special which they did enjoy.  We were able to catch up with each other for over 2 hours without feeling rushed.  This is one of the few places we will return to when wanting to eat at a restaurant inside any casino.  The food is decently priced, fresh, and tastes decent.  When we used our comp to pay for our bill, Tha never bristled like a few of the servers at the other places did.  Since he provided excellent service, he received a large tip.  That is what servers need to realize, even though the meal is comped, if you provide good service, most people will still tip you, and leave much more than usual since they did not have to pay for the meal.  I used to be a server so I know this for a fact!  It is all about the attitude and service next to the food.

Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: Has the pancakes and turkey sausage. Had to pay extra for blueberries though. Taste was fair. Service was a little slow but I'm satisfied.

Reviews.Author: This One
Reviews.Content: Finally had my first Cronut!!!!! OMG YUM!!!!! Thank you America for these lovely pastries! We tried the original and the lemon and they were both delicious. And they better be for $3.50 a Cronut. I will most def be coming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Eugene
Reviews.Content: I would never have thought of dining here unless I had to. In a recent scenario, I had to. Not that there is anything wrong with eating here at the America inside New York New York, but being in Vegas, there are so much other better dining experiences you can't get in your hometown. So why waste it on simple diner food? If I was a local then this would probably be a good place to just relax and dine at.  But if you have no choice, don't worry. I had the Prime Burger, which is a Half pound ground prime rib, Swiss cheese, red onion marmalade, demi glace and horseradish a√Øoli served with french fries. Everything tasted great and I had really no complaints.   The place is huge, but never got crowded. They have a cool map of the United States hanging above. It's like a 3D in your face map, so something cool to look at, or entertain your kids with as this would be a great place to dine with your family.  The menu is not overwhelming. There are times you hope the menu has so much stuff it overwhelms, then we complain. Then when it doesn't you have that feeling to still complain and wonder,  thats it?  There are plenty of selections, from salads, to soups, sandwhiches, entrees, etc. **YELP TIP** CHECK OUT THEIR WEBSITE FOR THE MENUS  There is a nice simple bar within the restaurant entrance if you want to get your drank on without being in a crowded place. It's INSIDE the NY NY, so you do have to go through the casino, but it is simple to find.   Would I eat here again? Sure! However, would I actually go here again? Only if I had to.  BTW, Great staff. Very friendly and not robotic in personality.  OPEN 24HRS

Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: This was the worst restaurant I've eaten at in Vegas. The food was cold. We ordered potato skins that cost $9 and they brought out a plate with 4 of the smallest potatoes I've ever seen and up could tell they were pre-made and frozen because they were still cold on the inside. We will definitely not be eating here again. It was way to overpriced for the quality of food.

Reviews.Author: Remy
Reviews.Content: Bloody Marys: Amazing. Vegas is a city that knows how to do the Bloody Mary right. America was no exception and they spiced the glass rims for an extra kick.   Steak and eggs: Decent. Then again, it's my go-to for hangover breakfasts (actually, all breakfasts) and the Bloody Mary stole the show, so I didn't pay too much attention to it.   Service: Sigi was our server. You know, I was, incidentally, at the same table as fellow reviewer Richard C. over here (we're crew - what's up punkass!) and I agree: Sigi was top-notch. Her hustle deserves a better forum in a better establishment.   Ian did indeed get six fries. It was embarrassing for everyone and I felt bad for the dude. And overall, the food was sub-par and America brought out the weirdness in everybody: Jeff - who is 6'5, was hungover and routinely eats like a garbage disposal - couldn't take more than a bite of his veggie sandwich. The bathroom was outside in the casino and it was weird with eight of us shuffling in and out of America for fifteen minutes at a time. The kitchen took too long to bring out our food. Even I grew a beard along with the rest of the man convention just sitting around waiting for our slop.   Also, I dropped a Benny on black at the roulette table afterward, and it went down the drain. I think it was because of America. Bad mojo.

Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Good for a very late night snack.    Food: 7/10 - For the late night menu it is good food.  Cooked properly.  Nothing to right home about but it get's the job done.  Eggs were cooked properly and the have some nice late night speicals.  Service: 6.5 / 10 - Service is friendly but slow late at night.  The place has a quiet feel to it late at night.  The server can disappear for 5-10 minutes at a clip.  If you need something you're kinda hosed waiting.    Cleanliness: 8/10 - No visible problems here.  Parking: 5/10 - Parking is the lot for the New York, New York hotel.  Restrooms: N/A - Didn't visit.  Overall: 6.5 /10 - A safe bet for a basic meal.  If you are looking for a fine dining experience, this isn't the place to go.  Think  diner

Reviews.Author: Marina
Reviews.Content: The star of the show was definitely the service! We had the best waiter and server! Travis was awesome! The food was mediocre, our Breakfast Burrito didn't have chorizo as stated in the description but was still ok. The Grown Up Grilled Cheese can be skipped completely as it is a greasy hot mess. The Sriracha Shrimp was basically tempura shrimp sprinkled with drops of Sriracha and marked up. The drinks were good, those were the only thing we did finish. Definitely not a place to return and not worth the almost $60+tip we spent on our meal.

Reviews.Author: Jordan
Reviews.Content: With all the terrible reviews I read as I got seated it almost made me change my mind but the serviced I received from Manny was great! My water never got empty and always checked up on us. Thank you

Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I debated on only 2 stars, but there are some redeaming qualities here.  Whether you like this place or not probably depends on what you order.  My wife got the dinner special which is an 8 oz. steak with 1/2 pound of crab legs, potato, veggies and a salad for $15.  Great value.  My wife liked her steak a lot and the crab legs were OK.  I got the vegetarian club which was not  that great but the fries were very good.  I got the mac and cheese before and I remember it being OK.   This place isn't expensive, but If you not getting the special then I can't really say its great value.  I can get a great vegi sandwich at the Cheesecake factory for a buck fifty more, plus this place charged $3.75 for crappy iced tea.  The only reason I gave this place 3 stars and not 2 was the good service.  My server was Neverly and he was very nice.  The hostess was very nice too.  The only reason I can see coming here is if you want the special or you are looking for a table service place where you don't have to wait.  I suppose it's a good place for kids too.  I actually wanted to eat at Nine Fine Irishmen but there was a 30 min. wait for two on a Tuesday.

Reviews.Author: NA
Reviews.Content: A nice way to opt out of the over-the-top buffet frenzy and crowds in Vegas.   Even when I've stayed at the Bellagio, I've walked to this place to grab a good old New York steak & eggs for breakfast ($14.95). It never disappoints - straight up just simple but consistently good. The lil blueberry muffin is an added token - spoiler alert: it has apple filling inside that lil thing.   Coffee is a carafe - so, not the hottest.  I ask for salsa to tame them bunch of hash browns and and picante kick to eggs~  OJ seems fresh squeezed.  Lots of families with early teen kids. Very nice family ambience.  Christmas music in background and Christmas decorations were added touch for the holidays - today is Xmas eve - and first day of Chanukah - and the place is busy but not crowded at all.  No particular discounts for M Life members (MGM Resorts loyalty program) but you can use your player's points if you have any. Also, you can charge the meal to your room at the Excalibur, even though America is located at NY NY, just a brisk walk across the bridge from the Excalibur  Free NY NY wi-fi.  Friendly service~

Reviews.Author: Sabrina
Reviews.Content: We stopped in here for lunch on a Monday while in Vegas. They have daily lunch specials. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs for $9.99. The meatballs were SO good, they were stuffed with cheese, and the pasta sauce was super light which is how I like my pasta sauce. My boyfriend built his own pizza and he said it was really good. Our server (can't remember her name) was great and the service overall was great. Would definitely come back and recommend!   Also, the donuts in the bakery in the front by the host stand look AMAZING but unfortunately we were full and did not try them.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I am not to sure how to begin on rating this place...I was not super excited about eating here in the first place but only agreed to because my daughters whole cheer team already planned a team dinner here. The first experience started off with saying they could only split up 4 different checks? We had 40 people with 13 different families? But oh well we decided to figure it out..the key here this place was dead as a door nail and not making an exception to this was totally ridiculous.   Well we decided to jump into the ordering process which was another nightmare...which again for a totally dead restaurant why would you leave 1 waiter to help out such a huge party leaves a big question on who is managing this place? I can't put all the blame on our server because he really was trying to hustle his butt off but I think the lack of sheer disorganization lead to the ultimate melt down.  Here we go food not coming out with everyone else's food...cold food...my wife's food never got ordered...mix ups with food...the mediocre food at best...then ultimate melt down; paying the bill. This literally took 30+ mins to get figured all because they couldn't put families groups together. In my opinion they brought this pain upon themselves and probably the reason why this restaurant had no customers in it...this was a once and done for me based on customer service, selection , and quality all the way around.

Reviews.Author: Romina
Reviews.Content: Giving this place 3 stars for ambiance, food was ok, service was slooooooooow. The place was almost empty and it took forever for the food to get to us, when it did eggs were hard on top from sitting out. The croissant donut was very good too. Other than that, I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here.

Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Great place for late night food when at NYNY.   Breakfast items and burgers are better than expected for a casino casual diner.

Reviews.Author: Theo
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest breakfast joint you'll ever eat at, but it is certainly one of the most convenient. At least if you are staying at New York New York. My boyfriend and I ended up eating here twice during our stay because it was right down the stairs from our room.  On our first visit, we ordered the BLT (applewood smoked bacon, lettuce and tomato on sourdough bread) and Corned Beef Hash & Eggs (slow cooked corned beef and shredded potatoes with onions and peppers, served with two eggs any style). Both were ok. The BLT was better than the corned beef. The corned beef was actually pretty bland, which was surprising because usually that type of dish is quite salty. On our second visit, we got the Breakfast Burrito (farm fresh eggs, black forest ham, bacon with chorizo sausage and pepper jack cheese, wrapped in a warm flour tortilla) and the King Club (roasted turkey breast, applewood smoked bacon, romaine lettuce and tomatoes on toasted sourdough). These two were a lot better than our first visit. They were good, but nothing too special about them.  The true stars of this place are the donuts. They are huge, sweet, and decadent. I mean, what isn't to love about a nice fresh donut? We got the Strawberry Shortcake (frosted strawberry icing with a vanilla & strawberry filling) and the Boston Cream (chocolate frosting and custard cream filling). I am usually not a fan of filled donuts, but these were so delicious.  The service was a little slow, but totally understandable because it was during the breakfast rush, but overall a pretty decent experience. I would go here again if I was staying in New York New York again.

Reviews.Author: Micki
Reviews.Content: It's kinda hard to find good 24 hour places in Vegas, as shocking as that is. Yet, America is not terrible. In Vegas terms it's more like a 2.5 but I just wasn't completely thrilled. The wait staff was nice but the food was meh. I ordered mashed potatoes with gravy and did not feel so hot afterwards. My friends' food was ok...the chicken wings were the standout among them. But hey, beats my last Vegas trip where I was too tired to go anywhere else for food in the wee hours than McDonald's. If you're on this end of The Strip, I'd say this is a solid late night option. During normal hours though...I wouldn't chance it.

Reviews.Author: Anya
Reviews.Content: My first (and I hope only) 1 star review. As  a New Yorker, I am offended. I have never tasted worse diner food and at real restaurant prices! And, on top of that, the service is horrible. My boyfriend and I were one of only two tables filled and yet they still didn't have time to come over and take our orders, bring us our drinks, and get our orders correct. Never again.

Reviews.Author: Beau
Reviews.Content: Oh God I forgot I ever dined here but I guess I just blocked it out. I came here with a group of 12 people. One thing in general about Vegas is that dining in large groups just screws everything up and I really feel that the service since they add gratuity automatically they feel they can just shut down quality service automatically. It took at least 20 minutes to get a seat on a fairly slow 11 am on a Monday. When we were finally seated we waited another 30 just to get our orders in. I understand that restaurants want to get the food out all at once. But, I really feel that if the food is done they should starting bringing it out. My whole crew ordered breakfast except me who ordered a club sandwich. The food no joke took almost an hour to come out and mine must of been finished first because the fries were ice cold and sandwich was soggy all the way through the bread. When it was time to pay we were not allowed to split up the check any less than 2 ways. The whole fiasco took over 2 hours and wasted a good chunk of the day for a group of my friends that were leaving that day. Never again and stay away.

Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: Ack... really really not impressed. It was about 9pm on Friday night. The restaurant was only 1/3 full. We had to wait like 20mins for them to put 4 tables together for our group of 9.   Finally got seated and took another 10mins before was had to flag down our waiter for water. Then had to flag him down again to take our order. Then another good 30 mins to get our food, which was a turkey club, 4 burgers, a fettucini alfredo, pepparoni pizza, and 2 chili cheese fries.   Now I'm not usually a stickler about service and stuff... but considering the place was only 1/3 full, and we were the only table that was recently seated in the last 30 mins, I was surprised at how slow things were.  After all the waiting, we were still underwhelmed by the food. The local Denny's is better then this place, and (depending on which Denny's) faster. The only thing that was on the good side was the chili cheese fries, but for me, it was still only so-so b/c I'm not the biggest fan of wedge fries, which is what they used. But it was decent since it was smothered with chili and you were weren't left with 1/2 a plate of plain fries and no chili in the end.   I'd say pass unless there's nothing else. Maybe the breakfast food is better?

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: The food was totally forgettable. The giant map of America in the main restaurant was the most interesting thing in the whole place.

Reviews.Author: Yasmin
Reviews.Content: Went here after a night out and the food was typical diner plates.  This was fine.  I enjoyed what I had: chocolate chip pancakes and a fruit plate.  I was irritated that their brunch menu was so limited.  What if I wanted waffles or french toast.  There were maybe 8 selections and not at all accommodating to someone who doesn't eat eggs or meat.  The ambiance was nice, the crowd was limited at the time I dined here and the waiter was attentive.  Overall, a decent place to catch a oversize meal after a night of drinking.

Reviews.Author: Lynette
Reviews.Content: I was hanging out with some friends in town at New York New York, got a lil hungry from all the money we were losing :( Travis was our waiter....OMG he was so super sweet!  I ordered a burger w swiss, saut√©ed onions and bacon....YUMMMMMMM BACCOONN!  Nickie ordered the sirloin special for $14.99 which included a baked potato and veggies.  Bob ordered the grown up grilled cheese and a chicken Caesar salad.   Everything was sooo good with the exception that my bottom bun of the burger got soggy....oh well.  Id definitely recommend this place for sure if in NY NY! They are open 24 hours, have pics of  America  all over the walls and have a cool piece of artwork of the US.  The food has a range of Italian and American!

Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by America.  We were staying at NYNY and were out at the pool all day.  Someone ordered a quesadilla, which they get from America, and it was pretty darn good.  So we went for a little snack.  I just had a chicken salad, and it wasn't bad at all for a quick bite.  I can't remember what the husband ordered, but be enjoyed his food as well.  Then we had the cheesecake.  I'm not a dessert person, but it was delicious!    It's open 24 hours so we returned later for a club sandwich.  America will not blow your socks off, but it's dependable & the service is good.

Reviews.Author: Jenna
Reviews.Content: This place went downhill FAST in the past 12 months.  I wish I would have read recent YELP! reviews prior to going.    Had this been a review for last year, it would have been 5 stars.  We went here last year for St. Patty's Day - they have a great menu of roasted potato soup, corn beef/cabbage/carrot/potato and creme brulee for dessert.  LAST YEAR we were served Guinness with green sugar rimmed glasses and the bartender gave us green beer (although they supposedly weren't allowed due to a mess on the bar the previous year).  Our waiter was GREAT!  Jump ahead exactly 12 months.  We returned for a repeat of the great time we had in 2010, however, we were met with HORRIBLE service and a bartender who REFUSED to add sugar to our Guinness!!  REFUSED!  I have NEVER been refused something so simple, plus they set precedence for it the previous year.  MARY was the bartender and BONNIE was our server - UGH!  NEVER AGAIN!  I even showed Bonnie a photo of my beer on my phone with the  America  napkin under it.  She really didn't care.  She also only checked on us once the entire 2 hours we were there, and we had to hunt down people to get us refills on drinks, and pay our bill.  The table next to ours agreed with the bad service when they had to yell for someone to take their bill, too.  The food was okay, the presentation of the corned beef/cabbage was much nicer last year.  And the dessert was blah.  We will be finding ourselves a new place to enjoy St. Patty's day and spend our money next year.  NYNY can kiss my Irish bootie!

Reviews.Author: Breonna
Reviews.Content: Good food, spacious restaurant  I had the Shrimp Pasta and it was delicious!  Chef Hernan really knows how to make some mean pasta!

Reviews.Author: Kasia
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we ate at upon arriving at the hotel.  We were hungry and felt that the food was good.  The waitress was great and service was awesome.  We stopped in for breakfast the next day and also got great service.  All the waiters and waitresses seemed very nice.  We had no complaints at all and the place is open 24/7 so that is always a plus.

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit. I first visited a couple of weeks ago with my family for brunch. The breakfast was really good, but the service was a little slow. On my second visit, it was New Year's weekend and we decided to stop in for dinner while staying at New York New York. The place was pretty empty and we were seated promptly. Our waiter was extremely professional and very warm and friendly. He promptly brought our drinks and then took our order. The service was excellent and prompt. The food was brought out and we weren't disappointed. The portions are good sized. The food is American cuisine so nothing special on the menu, but the food is good. The service was above average and because of this, we will probably come back. From experience, we will most likely visit again when it is not so busy so that we can enjoy the great service. Three stars for the food. Four stars for the service. This place is a solid 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York-New York this last weekend for 2 nights.   Both nights we ended up seeking refuge at the America Diner at some ungodly hour, much like old travelers of yore would seek refuge at a Tavern to escape the icy snowstorm howling outside.   Except in our case it wasn't howling but it was the incessant sound of clinging coins, and it wasn't a snowstorm but utter mayhem on the Casino floor.   Lastly, it wasn't icy but it was an inconceivable amount of cheap booze that would leave us clutching ourselves in agony the next morning.  While the food pretty much sucked at America, I'm still pretty fucking glad the place was still open at 3 AM on Sunday morning.  While my wife ordered the steak the first night, she opted for the pancakes the second night.   I went with the Macaroni & Cheese and a Spicy Chicken Sandwich the first night and the Macaroni & Cheese and Potato Skins the second night.    (Hey! Nothing like simple carbs to absorb an insane amount of alcohol lounging about in your stomach)  The first night, the Mac & Cheese tasted very much like I what I imagine a Salt Lick tastes like.   The Spicy Chicken Sandwich was anything but.  I'm guessing they ran out of Buffalo sauce and they figured I was too drunk to give a fuck.   While it's true I was too drunk to start an argument then & there, I knew I'd get these fuckers on Yelp sooner or later.    The Mac & Cheese the 2nd night was legit... not great but certainly better than the first night since I could actually glimpse the taste of cheese that time around.   My wife said the steak was completely fucked up and she's still having painful bowel movements some 48 hours later.   The pancakes were good, but then again how does one really fuck up pancakes now, right?  If this was the Bay Area, I'd probably give this place 1 star or 2 at the very most.   Seeing as they're open 24 hours a day though, I'm being generous and giving them 3 stars.   Besides, as drunk as we were, it's fascinating to realize that you're the most composed couple at 3 AM in here.   I feel bad for the waiters and waitresses here... They gotta deal with some seriously fucked up shit every day.

Reviews.Author: Cheri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY NY and just decided to eat here one night. There was no wait and it was near our rooms. It took awhile to get someone to notice us and take our order but after that everything was fine. I was feeling sick so I got some chicken noodle soup and it was actually really good! The bread they give you was nice & hot! I'm a bread fan so I enjoyed it. Got chicken tenders which were really good. Boyfriend stuffed rigatoni with a bolognese sauce - which he thought was just ok.   This place was okay - definitely not my favorite but not bad either.  Pretty sure the room service menu at NY NY is from this place as well.

Reviews.Author: Kulirma
Reviews.Content: We came here for a late breakfast. I loved how they have a breakfast menu all day. We ordered the Belgian waffle with strawberries, maple syrup, and whipped cream (all on the side). They give coffee with your own pitcher so you can refill on as much coffee you'd like. My husband is vegetarian so he ordered two eggs scrambled with hash browns, jalape√±os, and pepper jack cheese. He asked for it to be extra crispy but it ended up being still soft. Regardless it was still pretty good. The eggs however were not. It did not taste like real eggs to us. He also got a tall glass of chocolate milk which made it up to my Hubby. They do let you order donuts to your table but I did not see a menu for that at the seats. We were too full to get one but there is always next time.  The ambience is great for large groups, families (the kids will love the huge 3D artwork of America), and for couples as well. There is also a bar seating with TVs if you'd like to watch news or sports.

Reviews.Author: Alfonso
Reviews.Content: For a midday snack, you're probably better off at a fast food joint in the food court area of NYNY.  Appetizers to hold one over before dinner were just awful.  Calamari, salad, even a baby order of ribs:  served lukewarm/cold and just plain bad.  It's really difficult to imagine any of the entrees here as redeeming.  Earns extra star just for the interior styling -- the wall and the ceiling map are nice touches.

Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: MERICA!  America is a cafe within the New York, New York hotel. This was the final stop after a night of gaming, dancing, and drinking. Oh yes, drinking. We stumbled in to get some food in our stomachs before the ride home. The waiter wasn't too surprised with our state. Some heads on the table while others were running back and forth from the bathroom. He brought us all out some water and well as the Mt. Dew I ordered. We took some time viewing the menu and had him come back a few times. I ordered the chipotle chicken wrap, I was drunk but still trying to be healthy. My super drunk friend decided to order the fettuccine alfredo. I felt like that was a really bad decision but we boxed and she had it the next day. Apparently it was good. My wrap was pretty good but it had a lot of lettuce. Pulled some of it out.. and put some pepper in that baby boy and we were good to go. It also came with potato wedges which were awesome!! I was excited because i didn't realize they came with that. Over all it was a mediocre cafe experience and it might not even be as good if i went sober.

Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: This place is easy on the wallet and serves decent food when compared to most Las Vegas venues. The servers seem to be on the ball as well.  I had a Western Omlette that was ok and a Cheesburger and nachos that were ok during my two visits.  I will definately head back here if in the area during my next Las Vegas visit.

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: A decent joint for typical American food.  Good service.  Not awesome, but a good spot if you're craving food and in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Better places for breakfast. Hash was not crispy and awash in grease. Atmosphere was fun with a giant map of the USA hanging from the ceiling.

Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: This is not one of the better simple breakfast cafes in Vegas. Although the decorations inside are cute (huge USA map, etc.), it still has an odd feel to it inside. Not sure what it was - guess I thought that this place should have more people inside - especially considering every other place in Vegas is so packed.    The service was friendly, but the food was just lacking. I say skip it and eat your breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Vincent
Reviews.Content: Vraiment horrible, mes p√¢tes √©taient trop cuites, mon poulet caoutchouteux, √† √©viter... Et sans parler du service.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: This is a great restaurant if you want  ok  food and you are willing to wait an hour after you place your order.   The map is cool....sort of. Stop in and take a photo then go eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Maritza
Reviews.Content: Food and service is always great every time me and my boyfriend have came here. Pancakes are delicious!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: First, I did not want to come here.  I'm very adventurous with my food choices, but the group I was with is not.  They are very basic with their food choices.  That being said; America is a safe choice when trying to accommodate several people.  We were here about 9pm on a Friday night, and it was a ghost town.  Seriously, a Friday night on the Strip, and there were only two other groups of people.  The service was slow.  Ridiculously slow.  The waitress so very nice and attentive so it was not her fault it took an extremely long time for our food.  I'm not sure what was going on it that kitchen.  Maybe the waitress was actually cooking also. Who knows?   For an appetizer we had the ahi tuna and watermelon, and I had fish and chips for my dinner.  Very basic dishes.  Nothing outstanding or beyond my expectations.  But the Canyon Rose cocktail I had was awesome as was the Kamikaze shot.  Waitress: great, Food: average, Speed of Delivery: horrible.  I will not return because they are many other restaurants on my list.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: We hit here late after seeing a show. The prices are very reasonable for the strip. I had a trio of sliders. The burger was excellent, pulled pork was tender but a little sweet, fish taco was decent but fish didn't taste real fresh. My husband really liked the chicken wrap. With two beers it came to just $40.  Service was quick and very friendly. The one negative was they did not have their cronuts available at the late hour.

Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: Was raining our first day in Vegas, who knew, so we did monorail and hopped from casino to casino.  Ended up at the New York New York around 3 and were hungry so decided to give this a try since we hadn't eaten here before.  High ceilings, separate bar area with TVs where you can watch sports and a cool huge 3D map of the US on the wall.  Sort of fun to  look at while waiting.  Since there were just a few folks eating at that time, service was pretty quick so I can't speak to what it is when there is a crowd.  Server was very pleasant although once our order was taken and we got our food, never saw the person again so if there had been a problem, too bad.  Hubby had a king club, he said it was good, not wonderful.  I had a stir fry chicken salad.  It tasted good but was the oddest salad.  I think the lettuce must have walked by the dish and a few leaves jumped in because it was primarily cold noodles, shrimp, the menu said there were veggies in it, couldn't find any and topped with fried rice noodles.  The dressing was a sesame vinaigrette which was pretty good.    Think probably the better choice for eating is breakfast.  That menu looked better.

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: The huge map of the U.S. is the best thing about this restaurant. The coffee is terrible & the food is outrageously over-priced - although, it is a casino restaurant so I shouldn't expect better. I ordered french toast (which was almost $10, just for two slices of french toast - no eggs, no bacon, no other food included) and it was absolutely terrible.  It was basically bread smothered in cinnamon.  If this meal wasn't being comped by the casino, I would have been very upset.    The only upside about this restaurant is the service.  Our waitress was very nice & she is the only reason this place is getting two stars.  The price just isn't worth it.  We ended up paying $30 for two to eat breakfast (which was part of a $50 meal voucher we received from the casino for staying in the hotel) and then had to eat again afterwards because the food was so terrible.  Walk the 10 minutes to Denny's.

Reviews.Author: Emma
Reviews.Content: I literally was nauseous from the smell of my turkey burger w cheese. I just ate my fries..... Then threw up..... Also they said it comes with pickle spear...just slices...I love pickle spear

Reviews.Author: BJ
Reviews.Content: The service was curt, the food was basically Denny's quality, the prices were double what they should have been. The map was fun to look at, but I won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Catherine
Reviews.Content: My family and I were starving and there weren't that much restaurants opened at around 12am. This place looks so comfy, nice, clean, and looks like they have good food, but....  The service was horrible, we waited for around 15 minutes just to order our food. The waiters were lazy like they don't feel happy serving us. It was really terrible. The worst case scenario was that It took around 1 hour for us to wait for the food.  I will definitely NOT come back to this place. Nice huge map on the ceiling though.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: We were seated quick, the hostess was very polite, as well as our waitress. The place was not full, and we waited for our food for at least 30 min, we were about to walk out. Food wise my son didn't like the mac and cheese, it needed more flavor, other orders were a-okay.

Reviews.Author: Raych
Reviews.Content: Our last night in Vegas, out group of 10 needed to kill time before our red-eye flight so since we were already in New York New York gambling we decided to eat here (located right by the casino). The restaurant is huge and there is a giant map of the US on the ceiling with all of the famous things about each state.  I got the salon entree with the spicy BBQ sauce on the side (I do not like BBQ sauce) and I gave that sauce to the boys which they loved and used it on their hash brown and steaks. The salmon was small and not the best tasting but the veggies that came with my plate was excellent! I even substitute my mashed potato's for them but the waitress forgot then realized it and brought me a side of veggies. The bf got the spaghetti and he didn't like it and had better. For both our entrees it cost us about $36...kind of pricey for okay food. Everyone else thought their food was okay but they did say that the jambalaya was spicy and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Vera
Reviews.Content: server : Denise  Denise was extremely nice!!! If anyone from this restaurant every looks at these reviews please give Denise some appreciation because she was so nice to us and we most def enjoyed her!!!   We had a very long day and we wanted to eat before we took our road trip back to San Diego. We stopped by this place cause a friend discovered this place a couple of nights back. It wasn't too far from our hotel,Excalibur.  The only problem I had was with the host. They didn't seem approachable and I felt as if we ruined their day when we walked in.. So that was my only downfall for this place...   Food was so good! Lots and Lots of comfort food! I love the macaroni and cheese! Their chicken fried steak was good but nothing out of the ordinary. Prices are reasonable..What do you expect though, its Vegas. Lol :)    Will most def come back again on my next vegas trip! :)

Reviews.Author: Lindell
Reviews.Content: I ordered a good 30mins ago and that was the last time I also saw my server. There are a lot of empty tables.   Ramon is our server. I'm not sure where he went. I'm thirsty but I'm more hungry. Another stops by and says our food will be out soon. Ramon, where are you?!  Ramon came with the food! I should have went to another place. The only thing that was sub-par was the fries. The food is just bland or maybe I drank too much from last night and my taste buds are gone....nope, the food is blah.  Just order drinks...while playing the slots so you only tip.

Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: Came to the restaurant by 8:00 pm., waited for the server for 7-10 minutes even thou restaurant had 4-6 tables occupied. Waitress by name Rowena came to take the order. I am not sure if it was language issue with her or it was late in the evening, but whatever we ordered, she mixed up a few time and we had to correct her order. Regarding drinks from the bar... it was the worst experience ever. Bartender did not know the names of the drinks and when I found recipe on Internet, he refused to make it. For suggestion on a mixed drink bartender turned way and finally when I asked for a strawberry margarita, he made a plane Daiquiri drink. When I told the waitress about it, she got mad at me. I got upset that service is awful. Bottom line the evening was ruined. If you wish to be in my shoes lol visit this place.

Reviews.Author: Jeremiah
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was great! Had the chicken fried steak. Gravy was good. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Ralph
Reviews.Content: The food was good.  Food delivery was extreamly slow.  Our server was good.  But between our order and the delivery of our food we could have lost a grand inside the casino.  The food was good. But it is not worth the wait.  PS: The restaurant was not busy at all.

Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: Updating, since  America  went above and beyond to resolve my customer service issue of not receiving the 10 percent locals discount, I am happy to revise my rating. Always good to see a business respond so positively regarding customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Author: Louie
Reviews.Content: Great place to have breakfast if you happen to sleep in from a night of partying!  This place is located in New York New York Casino.  The restaurant boost American food fare and the decor of the place reflects that and there are plenty of seating.  We both ordered the Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs.  Originally we were gonna order all you can eat pancakes but we missed it (last serving was at 11:30 am for the AYCE pancakes @ $7.95).  Our food took awhile to be served but it was okay, the place was busy and we were busy admiring the decor of the place.  The food was good but I noticed it was a little overcooked.  Maybe it sat on food warmers before it was served to us because when they served us, they also served the other surrounding tables guests around us.  Maybe they need to hire more waiters and servers.  Now back to my train of thought, the food was overcooked, the hash browns was a little charred.  The scrambled eggs was perfect, nice and fluffy.  The other good thing was the gravy for the chicken fried steak, lots of flavor.     The THREE STARS only minus one star for location (had to walk through smoked filled casino to find this place) and overcooking our food.  Food           =    C Staff             =    B+ Decor          =    A Location     =    F

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Went after a concert around 2:30 am. Service was great. Wish I could remember his name. Super friendly made sure we had everything we needed multiple times. Went back again the next around the same time and our waitress was just as awesome! Thank you! Oh and the food is really good too!!!

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the strip just in time on a Monday afternoon for lunch and walked from Mandalay Bay, ending up in New York. We (workmate and I) figured we would give it a try, so we ordered drinks, water, 1 iced tea and 1 beer, and it took a long time to get them.   After about 20 minutes we finally got the attention of a passing wait person, who seemed to be a supervisor, and she made it apparent to the wait staff that we were waiting for drinks.  10 minutes later we finally got our drinks, ordered, and waited...waited...I took a picture of the cool huge US map for my Yelp review, and we waited...waited...waited...it must have been about 45 minutes later, finally got our food - two American burgers with fries.  So, the food was actually very good, and we were really hungry by that point so it went fast. We paid and left.  It's too bad we waited for so long, or I would have rated it a couple of more stars. I may go back if I need extra time to rest my feet ;)

Reviews.Author: Mathieu
Reviews.Content: Food is OK, Service is below average and the music is probably the worst Music that America can produce.

Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: The service was really bad. If you don't like working the late shift then don't work the late shift???  I requested them to toast the bread on my sandwich and the server said he could not? My fries were overcooked or the fry oil needed to be changed. They were open 24 hours which makes me feel bad for all the other patrons. The design of the place was really nice hence the 1 star.

Reviews.Author: BillnKris
Reviews.Content: Do not eat here.  The pancakes were old and cold - just run away

Reviews.Author: Toodee
Reviews.Content: Try the Corned Beef hash! Nice little family restaurant inside New York New York. As American as it gets. Kid friendly with a kids menu and plenty of breakfast choices for the adults. Service was great and the food tasted awesome. I had the corned beef hash and it tasted  homemade.  Definitely coming back.

Reviews.Author: Juan
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the most horrible places we've been to in Vegas. The only reason we came here was because we all drove 5 hours and were dying of starvation... literally!  First off, the service was horrible. The place was vacant and probably had 15-20 customers max, so I thought we were going to be tended to promptly. Nope we were wrong. We had to hail the waitress from across the room after we waited 10 minutes of getting seated. Did I mention we were dying of starvation?  The food finally came and it kept going down hill from there. Here's a few of the dishes we tried:  -Steak & Crab Legs: The Steak was so tough and gritty, it took my cousin almost 20 minutes to finish her steak. The Crab was still frozen. There were icicles still inside, inedible.   -BBQ Ribs: Not bad, but not that great either. This was probably one of the mediocre dishes we had  -Salads: We ended up getting a few of the salads (Asian Salad?). They were all horrible and had no taste what so ever.   -Turkey Sandwich: How can you go wrong with a sandwich, it wasn't bad.  Over all, this place deserves a 2 star rating entirely. We won't be back here again. I did like the fact that the manager did comp us some donuts , which were horrible also. BLAH!

Reviews.Author: Luca
Reviews.Content: We learned about the Cronuts (a peculiar mix between a donut and a croissant) while reading a Las Vegas guide so we decided to try one. America is one of the few places serving it and I'm glad we decided to try it there. The Cronut itself was great, but also the bagel was absolutely tasty. Service was polite and friendly and very attentive. The atmosphere is of a huge diner and I love how the place is decorated, with that huge 3D USA map with every state represented by its own symbols.

Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I love to eat here when I'm in town.  They are open 24hours and have always had impeccable service and food.  The prices are reasonable and the restaurant is fairly quiet, with big booths to relax in, away from the hustle and bustle of the casino.  A couple things to try if you stop in here: their omelets and gigantic donuts.  Both are mouth-watering and hit the spot every time.  Did I mention how wonderful service is? The waiters and waitresses are attentive and nice.  A big plus in my book!

Reviews.Author: Jaya
Reviews.Content: Had breakfast here. The place was pretty much empty around 8 AM which is quite normal for Vegas I guess.  Got a cronut...had to...love them. Got the one with lemon glaze. YUM.  I built my own omelet. It came with rye bread which had caraway seeds in them, tasted pretty good with butter. Hubby got the brioche french toast and thoroughly enjoyed it.   The place was neat, prices nominal and the staff were attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Franco
Reviews.Content: Came here this morning to get a donut and coffee for my girlfriend who was still in bed because she wasn't feeling good. I get here at 6:45am. I try and order coffee and a cronut and the girl there tells me they are still closed. The resteraunt is opened 24hr, but the donut shop section opens at 7am wtf??? Doesn't make sense. This is Vegas, a 24hr city and the donut shop opens and 7am. It don't make sense.   The girl agreed to sell me a cronut, but since she said her coffee wasn't ready, I went to Starbucks for the coffee, which by the way opens very early.  You might want to change your hours. I saw people walking in for coffee and being told they were closed. So they went down to Starbucks.

Reviews.Author: Craving Cholent
Reviews.Content: There's absolutely no reason to eat here unless it's the only place that's open...and even then you may want to rethink your options.  Service by the wait staff was fine...friendly and fairly attentive...service from the kitchen was quite slow.More importantly, the food was just plain 'blah'. And at $20 a head for breakfast it should be a lot better than 'blah'.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Went here for breakfast the first morning, was delicious and the service was great. Had the corned beef hash which was awesome. Giving 4 stars because their bloody Mary's are not that great.

Reviews.Author: Bennett
Reviews.Content: Ok, the mac and cheese alone is worth five stars IMHO.  But there is a catch with this place.  Long wait times brings the whole experience down a notch.  But damn if the mac and cheese isn't good.  I've been here three times.  I've always pulled up a chair right at the bar.  You can avoid waiting in lines, which can tend to form at certain points in the day.  America is located inside the New York New York Hotel-Casino.  Above all the tables posted on the wall is a huge sculpture type deal of the United States.  All the menu items have some tie to a city in the U.S.  (mac & cheese = Austin, Texas)  Again, I've waited around a half-hour for my food sometimes.  That's my only gripe.

Reviews.Author: Marina
Reviews.Content: Cold eggs. Crappy sevice. Rude manager. NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This place sucks.  First of all, their coffee is $4 and my husband thought it was awful.  Second, I really like businesses that put their customers first and their priority is to make sure that you are happy.  So when I ask to substitute a muffin for toast, and pay the $1 difference (the price difference if you order them a la carte), and this isn't okay, it makes me really wonder about where their brains went.  It is a little detail like that which is the difference between true hospitality and a restaurant that is just out to make a buck.  Also, I was really bummed about that muffin :)

Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: This place is getting 5 stars and even getting a review from me for one main reason...   ... RIch... the bartender...   We are making a 15 hour trek from CA to CO and our first stop is to blow some cash in Vegas... let's check out New York NY...   So 300.00 down the drain and down on our luck we are hungry... starving say the least... we walk around and find America.   We decide to sit at the bar ( some thing i rarely do).. watch some college football... and order up some grub. Rich comes over to take care of us.. and take care of us he does. Charming personality, and doesn't seem to get ruffled....   One thing my friend and I love to do is watch people tip. We watched him serve up things great time after time, and never flinch when gathering up his tips.. be it the 50 cent change or 2.00 for a 3.00 beverage.. he smiled, checked on his entire client group ... along the bar... often.   I like this place, good bar set up, nice sizable dining area.. and a great big map of the USA, with little symbols on each state.. probably a great place to take you kids.. should you have had to bring them to Vegas... and get a little education out of it.   The price is the price... what you would expect from a Vegas Restaurant... 2 bud light drafts, 1 Pepsi, 2 chicken sandwiches .. and edamame... oh yeah, and the food we extremely satisfying...   Like I said, RIch is 2 of these stars alone. He was great with his co-workers.. his shift ended while we were there and we hurried up and cashed out and give him what we thought hopefully made up for the lower, unappreciative, prior tips!!

Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: boo hoo.....leaving NYNY and vegas, so we ate here for our last breakfast. it reminds me of America...pretty standard breakfast options, basic belly filling food.   the giant map of America is really cool. i had the veggie omlette and my wife had the veggie frittata. both were actually very good and easier on the wallet than alot of places. our server was perfectly friendly and made us feel welcome. kept the coffee and water coming.   i'm glad we came here and would come back.

Reviews.Author: Cassandra
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this place for breakfast. We ordered a make your own omelet and the eggs Benedict, both were delicious. Service was good. The gourmet donuts are absolutely amazing. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Angelo
Reviews.Content: Late night eats is a big deal in Vegas and if you find a spot that serves something epic at 4am in the morning after a night out with the fellas, you may end up there two nights in a row like us. Located inside New York New-York is a restaurant open 24 hours called America.  The theme is exactly that where there's a giant model of America floating above with states labeled according to specialty.  Our first visit was at 4am in the morning with only one other group in the restaurant.  There was a sign that advertised a 16oz Ribeye Steak Special for $12.99 from 12am-5am. Are you kidding me!  Forget the steak and eggs, get me the special! I ordered the Special, rare of course.  This steak was big!  It took up half the plate and was plump and juicy!  My steak was cooked perfectly!  A steak like this can easily go for $20-$25.   Check it out!  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Cheap for vegas. Quality is on level with dennys
