The food mind have not been any better but I'll bet the service would have been faster and the cost 1/3 of what we paid.

Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: I took the family for Easter dinner and was very disappointed!  The service was very slow and somewhat rude. I had a chicken parm and it was very mediocre. The chicken breast was over-breaded and very thin and the pasta was so over cooked it was one big lump.  Other reviews talk of the big map but when they seat you in the back next to the kitchen you aren't so impressed.  Of all the places in Vegas I have been this one is on the bottom of the list.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: The America Caf√© is located in the New York New York Hotel & Casino and is the only restaurant in the hotel that never closes.  It offers an extensive variety of diner/bar food that includes appetizers, salads, sandwiches, pastas, limited entr√©es, and a few breakfast items.  It has a big dining room with a large bar and the d√©cor is unremarkable except for the huge map of the USA on its ceiling.   My wife and I stopped there around midnight after a late show for a light bite.  The place had few patrons and we sat at the bar.  Our female bartender was amicable and poured each of us a good drink.  My wife and I shared a triple-decker club sandwich and a side of French fries.  The sandwich was tasty and the fries were hot and flavorful.  The food and drinks hit the spot and nicely satisfied our late hour cravings.   The America Caf√© is recommended for providing a convenient, simple meal at a late hour.

Reviews.Author: Benjamin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had breakfast here on our stay in Vegas. Service was really good and the food was on point. Got the steak and eggs and I will definitely go back for it again! Its a solid spot for a meal and they have a cool map hanging above all tables. They also have a donut shop right when you come in but after eating a big meal, we had to pass on the donuts but will shoot for it next time! Good place!

Reviews.Author: Kelli
Reviews.Content: Food was plentiful!  The $7.95 all you can eat pancakes are three large to start and very good.   I had the breakfast bagel sandwich.  It was huge and had huge serving of hash browns.  Could have easily split meal with someone.  Kids pancakes are three fairly good sized as well. My kids only ate 1/2 and cold have easily split as well.

Reviews.Author: Washington
Reviews.Content: Low quality ingredients. Basic concept dishes. Nothing exciting but works in a pinch late at night.

Reviews.Author: Ronald
Reviews.Content: Only my second time inside New York, New York, and right around dinnertime after riding the roller coaster. Seeing the restaurant America, we decided to give it a try with the cool huge map of the USA overhead.  I ordered the Fish and Chips which was decent, while my wife had the Caesar Salad. But nothing was beyond average. Friendly wait staff but somewhat slow, with the place less then half full. We even ordered the Hot Fudge Brownie Sundae, on the recommendation of the manager who stopped by our table to check on us. The Brownie was way too gooey and gummy, and between the two of us sharing, way too much. On her return pass by, the manager greeted us again with the words,  Isn't that just the best dessert you've ever had?  Fortunately, she kept on walking past us because our response would have been NO!  Maybe we'll give they're breakfast a try on a future visit, dinner was just ok average.

Reviews.Author: Maximillian
Reviews.Content: It's just kinda there and convenient, especially if you're staying at NY NY or if you're around at ungodly hours (which I suppose could be any hour in Vegas). Better than Denny's. I had a pretty good Turkey Reuben here. Came back for an okay omelette breakfast the next day, OJ is freshly squeezed here. Awesome giant map of America sculpture (can't miss it). And they have a bar--bonus!

Reviews.Author: Layla
Reviews.Content: Cheap breakfast that felt like it should have been fast.  Except it wasn't, at all.  Worst service that I have encountered in quite some time, which is impressive if you read my reviews frequently since I am a fucking fly trap for piss poor service.  Our food was FINE. It's basically IHOP with a better menu and a pretty low penalty cost for substitution.    This place is huge though, so even with a line, you'll be seated within 10 minutes at almost any hour.

Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Typical diner food; not bad by any means but just an alternative to Denny's and the like. Grown up grilled cheese was good. The bakery in the front is the best part; the Cronut is definitely worth treating yourself to!

Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: The place is perfect for families looking for a fun place to eat on a budget. The food was great for the price and it had a great atmosphere. The staff was very attentive, kind, and friendly and that's all I ask for.  The restaurant doesn't WOW you strictly by the food, but overall it's a great place for a casual dinner in the New York, New York hotel. I would suggest this place to friends!

Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: On our last night in Vegas, we decided to have one last meal.  On our way back to our hotel (Excalibur) we passed through the NYNY.  Did a search on the restaurants in NYNY and found that America was the only non bar open at that time (1 am).  Menu looked decent, certainly appeared to be better than McDonalds.  Hostess was nice, we were seated right away.  Waiter comes and takes our order, and then we wait.  And wait.  And wait.  45 minutes passes, no food, and I haven't seen our waiter in at least 25 min.  I flag down the hostess, who says she will find out what is going on.  About 3 min later I see our waiter saunter in from out of the restaurant.  He goes to the back, and surprise surprise, our food is ready!  I had ordered a burger, my wife the night's special, a sirloin steak, medium well.  The steak was burned to a crisp, definitely medium well.  My burger, while it did not appear burnt, tasted burnt.  The bun was soggy as well.  Not what we expected after waiting 45 min.  We contacted the manager who was very apologetic, and offered to get us some cold sandwiches from the menu.  We declined and he did not ask us to pay for the meals.  He said that he would be talking to the cook about it.  We will not be going into this restaurant on our next Vegas trip.  Seriously, you are better off going to Denny's or McDonalds if you are hungry late at night.

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: $12.95 ribeye from midnight to 5am!  I love my deals and I thought the ribeye was great for the price.  I came here late at night for dinner and shared the ribeye and chicken wings.    I surprisingly loved both.  The chicken wings were tender and of great flavor.  The 16 oz ribeye was pretty juicy and quite delicious!  Our waitress was really kind and attentive to our table.  I'd definitely come back here again for lunch/dinner or even late night grub.

Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: Although this restaurant is open 24/7 and has decent food, i'm going to have to knock it.  Service was TERRIBLE and there were hardly any diners in the place.  It was far from crowded.  We asked our server for more water and a few lemons, and he forgot both, even after we reminded him.  We had to help ourselves from the lemons at the bar- LAME.  Then he made some comment like,  I could have brought those to your table, you know,  full of attitude.    When we finally got our bills (he also had major 'tude with giving us individual tabs), he had given us all of our change in quarters.  Some of us had more change than necessary and some of us were short-changed.  NONE of us had the correct change.  At this point I lost it and proceeded to go pretty much ape sh*t on our 45 year old server with a comb-over.   Excuse me, look- all of our change is completely um, how do i say this, NOT RIGHT. AT ALL.   He gives me a blank stare and then shrugs it off:  Sorry, we don't have any other coins except quarters here.  We give change in quarters.  Then he smiles sweetly and says,  Would you like to speak to the manager, miss?   the rest is pretty ugly from there.  Now, let me clear that i am not expecting the world's greatest meal OR service from America the restaurant inside a Vegas casino.  However, I do expect to get what i pay for and that includes getting the correct change back, NOT IN JUST QUARTERS.   As far as this restaurant goes, it's America the Shitty, and I would rather just roll to any other hotel's 24/7 cafe to eat.  They all have one.  The club sandwich was good though...Meh.

Reviews.Author: Annette
Reviews.Content: Yummy banana pancakes.    Service is okay, the place is clean and convenient when you re staying at NY NY

Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: Had the chocolate chip pancakes as big as my HEAD! So good. Trust me, you do not even need syrup for these pancakes, but they are sweet enough with all of those chocolate chips. Had a side of bacon, but I hate it when my bacon is still  oinking,  so I asked for it to be well done. It was still undercooked for my tasted and it gave me a few snorts. Didn't dare to ask for them to throw it on the grill b/c the kitchen was a marathon away from our table and service was just a little slow. Slow, but very nice and appreciative that we were there. I give that a two thumbs up.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Jesus man. Finding a 24 hour cafe like in  a casino is like pulling teeth! But of course NYNY does not disappoint and we finally found America to curve our 3am cravings. I must say the prices were pretty good for Vegas too. They have a really cool large map sculpture of the United States on the ceiling. I had the Empire State Plate which is a breakfast plate with two eggs, hashbrowns, sausage, and toast. Everything was cooked just right. It was really good!!! My husband got a hamburger that he felt was just average. We had a great waiter who was kind and he always made sure we had what we needed. The only things that was slightly annoying was that the place was pretty dead and it took forever to get our food! I don't know what the hold up was considering there as not alot of other people in the restaurant. That is why I am deducting a star. Other than that is was a great place for late night eats with good competitive prices. I will go back.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: What an awesome place to eat. Decently priced for a casino based restaurant. Food choices are kind of limited but still a good meal for the buck. Service was also very good and food got out quickly. I highly recommend it as a place to eat

Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!!!  Love this place. Great food and even better service.  Jenna, best bartender ever, is so kind, patient and accommodating as is all the staff at this restaurant.  The manager, Kelsey, was also very accommodating as she honored my order even though I made a huge mistake in the time it was being offered (their rib eye steak dinner).    I didn't stay at NYNY this trip but I will definitely stay there next time I visit Vegas just because the staff is so amazing.  There is much to be said of a company that hires and trains their employees to go above and beyond with their customers, even when the customer is wrong.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Servive was great, food was way overpriced, and below mediocre.  Coffee was $3.75 and blah.  Will not return.

Reviews.Author: Sheila
Reviews.Content: Great service, nice large restaurant and bar area, and good food. My cousin ordered his usual chicken fettucini alfredo. My boyfriend and I split the fish and chips. The ranch for fries and tarter sauce for fish, were on point. The beer was cold, and I'd return if staying at NYNY again.

Reviews.Author: Alyssa
Reviews.Content: It was 2am and I was too tried to leave the hotel. The server was really nice. He told us about the  special  (12 oz ribeye with mashed potatoes and veggies). It was the thinnest steak I've ever seen. It was extremely chewy. I could only take 4-5 bites and that was covered in A1. Ick. I still regret it this morning because I can remember how terrible it was. It was not steak. It was  steak.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: (Note, there are two listings for this same restaurant on Yelp - the other is listed as  America Restaurant  http://www.yelp.com/biz/america-restaurant-las-vegas-2#hrid:Jf3KrDuLYfIVeMXPEYZKEw/)  Items sampled: Coffee Frosted Flake French Toast Monte Cristo - Black Forest Ham, Sliced Turkey, Gouda, Brioche Apple Fritter Boston Cream - Chocolate Iced, Custard Cream Filled Monkey-See Monkey-Donut - Bananas Foster-Filled with Chocolate Icing, Toasted Nuts Nutella Cronut Candy Cake - Chocolate Cake Donut, White Sprinkles, Chopped Reese's Peanut Butter Cups  Probably not the first place on most Las Vegas gourmand agendas, the 24/7  America  at New York-New York Casino had always interested me if only for its kitschy design plus one of the city's few Monte Cristo sandwiches, but it was not until I heard about the restaurant's in-house donut program that I finally committed to an early morning visit; the expansive restaurant largely unoccupied as servers joked around at the bar while  American  Top-40 played from speakers hidden by the enormous map of the good ol' USA.  Featuring a menu of expectedly American classics ranging from pancakes and waffles to country fried steaks and eggs it was with a bit of disdain that I arrived to find the Monte Cristo now relegated to the 'lunch' menu but happy to accommodate given the restaurant's 24-hour nature it was with a simple request that the sandwich was prepared and arriving on a covered plate alongside the Frosted Flake French Toast both dishes would prove competent , though nothing to write home about, with prices and portions both in line with other Las Vegas Boulevard breakfast joints thus leaving plenty of stomach space for a sampling of the restaurant's deep fried dough.  Featuring no less than a dozen different varieties with three cronuts plus fritters, crullers, filled, raised, cake, and fancy on display it was with a bit of indecision that I pondered my options and eventually settling on a few personal favorites plus those most interesting a quintet was selected at a total of $12.50 and aside from the lackluster, artificial banana flavor of  Monkey See, Monkey Do-nut  the results were very impressive indeed; the 'cronut' as close to Dominique Ansel's original in texture as I've found (a plus for those seeking authenticity, though I still prefer Coco's rendition to both,) the Boston Cream featuring surprising subtle custard inside a delicate yeasty pocket, and the apple fritter rife with fresh fruit beneath a delicate sugar crunch plus plenty of cinnamon rivaling some of the finest I've ever sampled; the best in Las Vegas by far.

Reviews.Author: Robyn
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place for breakfast! They cook your food to order and their bloody Mary's are delicious. This place was everything we needed after staying up so late! I'd recommend the family farm eggs Benedict if you're trying to concur a hangover and take a nap afterwards. Yum!

Reviews.Author: ivan
Reviews.Content: This is our second try on Christmas Day for breakfast. Last night, had late dinner. Overall, the restaurant is decent. We ordered over six adult entrees on each visit. The quality is inconsistent. From a rock hard bagel and ice cold dinner rolls to a great, seared rib eye and wonderful crab legs, we don't know what to think. The restaurant is huge on the inside which is deceiving because of the tiny entrance.  The wait staff are nice, but rarely checked on us.  They could be short staffed. The food took forever to arrive. For the price, there are better options on the strip.

Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: Good Waitress and Fresh Jalapeno  Poppers made for a good experience. We went in November, so unfortunately know I can not remember our waitresses name, but she was nice and knowledgeable.  We started with the Jalapeno poppers and it was nice to have them done the way they were originally intended, with fresh crispy peppers and not frozen from some bowling alley, We shared the pork chop entree even thought it was only one.  She liked it and I thought it was just OK. Our nice lovely waitress whose name still escapes me, suggested a dessert instead of doughnuts and it was spot on.  I can't remember what the dessert was either.  Oh, did I mention that the drinks there were ok and flowing.   Sorry for the gaps in the story, I would like to blame it on the booze, but its probably the on set of old age.   Bah!

Reviews.Author: amarilla
Reviews.Content: Came here for breakfast on a Saturday. We got a table right away, that was the only fast thing about our meal. We waited probably close to an hour for our breakfast. I gobbled my meal up not because it was amazing but after that long wait- I was starving. In addition, the runner spilled the syrup on the pancakes and said he would be right back with fresh ones but never came back. The coffee was not tasty. I suggest you visit the host of other breakfast places in LV besides here.

Reviews.Author: Catalina
Reviews.Content: I didn't love this place but then again, I didn't hate it. The husband and I were just walking around in NYNY trying to stay dry from the rain that weekend. We were hungry but not starving so we wanted to grab something quick to eat. We walked by the America Restaurant and the cronut's at the entrance basically welcomed us in. We were quickly offered a table to sit at. The place itself is interesting looking. There is a HUGE United States 3D map. Looks pretty cool and it is def something to stare at for a while. The restaurant is pretty big but to my surprise was pretty empty too. We decided to just order appetizers and our waiter took our order. We ordered the potato skins because it caught our attention being that it had chorrizo. Took quite some time before our order came out, too long for a place that was empty and for an appetizer. The potato skins were interesting and unfortunately a bit on the luke warm side rather than hot. It tasted like it had refried beans, chorizo and sour cream. The chorizo was pretty good and it made the plate worth it. The price was fair and service was alright. As far as going back, probably not. We decided to not get a cronut on the way out since the food was just ok, we didn't want to risk a disappointment. The restaurant is sort of like a diner so if you are looking for diner food, they have it here. I did see a couple next to us share a sandwich and fries and boy was that a large order.

Reviews.Author: Trina
Reviews.Content: If you want regular American food that tastes okay and is the same quality as Denny's, go here and pay 76 dollars for your meal.  All I ordered were chicken strips, a steak, and fried chicken.  And yes--it was 76 dollars.   Mediocre food doesn't deserve a good rating, and although edible and an interesting ambiance, it was not worth the money at all.

Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: We had purchased tickets to see Zumanity and had to pick up the tickets at the box office one hour prior to showtime so we decided to grab dinner here.   I went in prepared for some run of the mill, plain old, American food given that the name of the restaurant is AMERICA. We ordered steak with baked potatoes and grilled veggies. The grilled veggies were the highlight of my meal since the baked potato remained mostly undisturbed and my steak was salty.   Everyone my age remembers where they were when Princess Diana died, when the Twin Towers fell and now where they were when they heard Bin Laden was killed... me?... I was watching coverage on Fox News while in an establishment called  America  inside a hotel called  New York, New York !!!! TRUST ME... the irony of this was not lost on me... at all.

Reviews.Author: Victoria
Reviews.Content: Albert was an exceptional waiter and bar tender!!! I would recommend anyone to have a late night snack and drink, great prices! Thanks Albert! :)

Reviews.Author: Heidi
Reviews.Content: Came here at 4am with the munchies. Their late night menu was showing on the electronic menu at the entrance and I decided on buffalo wings. You can order to-go at the bar. The bar was filled with security guys that probably got off their shifts and the bar tender this night was too busy flirting with them. We put our order in for buffalo wings but she said they weren't serving it right then, they only had the breakfast menu. We asked for the menu, she walked away back to the guys and we couldn't get her for another 5 mins. Finally ordered the foot long hot dog.

Reviews.Author: Irene
Reviews.Content: After walking around the strip with a 5 year old, we were starving and jumped into New York New York thinking that they had a nice cafe for lunch. Spotted America and thought it would be a good place to eat. The hostess seated us right away and even gave our daughter crayons and a place mat to draw on. It wasn't crowded. There were only 5 tables in use. There were 3 bus boys cleaning off tables. Oh wait! Make that two bus boys and one server cleaning off tables. We waited and waited and waited. After 15 minutes nobody came to even offer us water or something to drink. Really annoyed we got up and left. The hostess looked up surprised to see us leave and asked us what was wrong. We told her and she told another girl up front to get the manager, but we did not stay to see the fireworks. Took a cab back to Mandalay Bay and had a decent lunch at Raffles Cafe.

Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: So, I notice that they have remodeled this place since last year. They added a ice cream parlor & donut shop and that's dessert on your way out the door. They always have great dinner and late night snack deals on a daily basis. It's open 24 hrs and I've always have good experiences here. Im a fan

Reviews.Author: Anita
Reviews.Content: Mediocre food, bad service. At least our server was friendly, when he eventually came around. Wanted something quick, ended up with cold food that took too long to arrive.

Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: Had a great lunch. Employees had a great sense of humor. Good service. Thank you to Ashley, Pepe and Kelly. We enjoyed our time in America.

Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: The food was delicious, the service was perfect, & the restaurant is super cool.   I had the (Deconstructed) Grilled Veggie Pita & the husband had the Monte Cristo. Both were absolutely delicious. The portions are spot on as well. Mine was just enough, while the husband ended up eating only half (it's a big sandwich).  Started with the Mozzarella & zucchini sticks. Very good!

Reviews.Author: Briget
Reviews.Content: Open late for all the club stragglers. Nothing else was open, so we came across this place. Inexpensive steak and potato dinner and was pretty fulfilling. Worth what ya pay for. I mean I wouldn't go here if I had other options but it's not that bad for a Denny's-type restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm giving this restaurant one star is because of our waitress who went out of her way to make my mother's meal free. Other than that, I regret having ever ate at this place. Sure the big map of America is nice to look at, but out of the four of us only my boyfriend's mother liked her food...and she got mac & cheese which is hard to mess up. It took about 45 minutes for our food to come out and when it did it was luke warm. I got the buffalo chicken sandwich and it was gross and dry. I asked for more buffalo sauce and they brought me out a bowl of tasteless sauce that had been watered down one too many times. I definitely learned from my mistake and will not be returning here by choice.

Reviews.Author: My
Reviews.Content: Had a early morning breakfast with the family after waking up too early due to Jetlag. A decent breakfast where everyone of us managed to get more than full.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Skip the buffets and come here for breakfast! Delicious and reasonably priced! Eggs are fluffy (and REAL, unlike the buffets' powdered egg stuff), and the food's like homemade. Generous portions and friendly service too!

Reviews.Author: ryan
Reviews.Content: Food here is expensive and not very good. It's a nice place to sit and sober up though which is why I give it 3 stars.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I thought this was just an ok restaurant.  We were staying at NYNY and decided to eat at America's (after much  discussion  among eleven people). Because of the time of day we arrived, we were given the breakfast menu.  The menu seemed like your typical diner food. The only disappointing thing is that they don't offer combo dishes. I ordered the cinnamon apple waffle but if I wanted it with a side of eggs and bacon, it was an additional charge (like $4 for each item!). But maybe I'm just used to the Dennys and IHOPs and whatnot.  Servers were polite but it took a while for our meals come out. We were told that they wanted to bring everyone's meal out at the same time (keep in mind we had eleven people). Unfortunately some meals weren't as warm as others.  Despite that, food was ok. Everyone in the party seemed satisfied. The bagel and lox seemed like a popular dish amongst us.  The best thing about this experience: it was comped. Thank goodness for the gamblers in the group.

Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Food is basic American with decent portion sizes.  Decor is interesting although the place has been open for quite awhile now.  Food just decent, nothing special.

Reviews.Author: Alice
Reviews.Content: Came here for my cousin to get a cronut and for me to try some sort of fun, new donut. She wanted the chocolate cronut, but the man before us got the last one so she ended up with original. She hates lemon flavored a stuff, but sure enough, the glaze had a citrus tang to it. It also felt a bit dry in the mouth.  I read that the Bavarian cream donuts were yummy on yelp so I was ready to get that.   Once I was there I saw several cream filled LOOKING donuts and asked the cashier how they were all different. She gave me a HORRIBLE answer.  Umm, They're pretty much all the same.  Me:  So what's the difference between the donut labeled 'Bavarian Cream' and the one with the dollop of cream on top?  Cashier  That they  look different.  I tried to laugh a little to ease the awkward rudeness and got the cute and supposedly cream filled donut. *insert annoying buzzer sound here* It wasn't filled! It was just the little dollop on top!   Though the cream was delicious (as I read on yelp), the DOUGH of the DOUGHnut was dry as heck! I was very disappointed. And the customer service didn't help at all.

Reviews.Author: Gloria
Reviews.Content: The best part of this restaurant was the awesome decor! There was a massive replica of the United States which was fun to look at! Other than that the food was sub-par. Our table ordered chicken noodle soup (which was good), a burger (that was overcooked, chicken tenders (that were more like chewy chicken nuggets), and biscuits and gravy that were okay but were luke warm. The service was bad. The location and lack of a wait time where a plus but we obviously know why there wasnt a wait time.

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: We came here two times during our stay.  Once when I was told that I had wait an hour to check in and the second time for breakfast.  For lunch we had a sampler platter and it was pretty good.  It had potato skins, chicken wings, quesadilla, and mozzarella triangles.  When we came for breakfast the next morning we had bacon, avocado omelets with hash browns.  WOW!!!  That omelet was one of the best I have ever had...and the hash browns were nice and crunchy!  The service that we received both times was great.  The decor of this restaurant is really unique with a huge map of the U.S. hanging up and matching tables and booths.  They also decorated for Christmas and it looked really nice.  Overall, a good experience on both my visits and I will be back again for sure!

Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I came here twice, once for breakfast and the same night for dinner.  I loved my breakfast. The service here is very very pleasant, they are a bit slow however, happened both morning and night. I had eggs, hashbrowns, toast and orange juice. I ate everything and found it delicious. My bf was not a fan of the stuffed french toast however.   I came back for dinner because at breakfast I saw they have a $15 steak and crab leg dinner. The dinner was good for $15. It came with a baked potatoe, salad or soup and bread. The steak was average but good enough for the price. The crab legs were pretty decent not the best but good. The potato was great. The salad was average. The bread was amusing. We didnt get it right away and we asked the waitress about it and she said she doesnt bring it out unless someone asks for it because she figures it is enough food and we wont need it. Ummm, yeah give me my bread. The bread wasnt very good but my bf ate it to spite the waitress haha.   Dinner was cheaper than breakfast strangely.

Reviews.Author: Lubs
Reviews.Content: Service wasn't that great. My friend ordered bacon with her breakfast and was charged for it, but got no bacon. After finally flagging down our waitress (the place wasn't busy at all), she adjusted it and even took off the required gratuity for our party of 8. That was pretty nice I guess.  The food was less than mediocre. Less tasty than your typical Denny's or IHOP.  I believe this is the same place where NYNY's room service comes from...based on the similarity in menus and presentation. The food is acceptable when it's the middle of the night and you don't want to get out of bed, but if you're looking for a place to have lunch or dinner...go elsewhere.  One star for the very cool ginormous map of the USA that I wish I got a picture of!

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: All around a good experience, service great, food very good, but nothing out of the ordinary. Still looking for places that are a 5- extraordinary, something to tell everyone about, etc... But when you get what you order in a timely manner and it tastes good, it's a 4...

Reviews.Author: MariSol
Reviews.Content: During my stay on Vegas I came here three time and in all honesty it was because I was too lazy to walk out of the hotel since it was cold.  1st time - breakfast, overall it was descent price but the quality of food was ok.  2nd time - late dinner, decent price for food and the steak was actually yummy and better than ok.  3rd time - they hosted the Super Bowl party loved the bottomless drinks but was sick as a dog that I couldn't enjoy the drinking and the finger/game food they had sucked. Totally, not worth the cost we paid.  FYI - I'd compare this place to something like Denny's.

Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: It was the only decently quiet location in NY NY on a Thursday night at 1230 am, so it was exactly what I needed. I had two vodka sodas, and a turkey burger with fries. It was definitely edible, not the best thing known to man, but it served my needs at the time (returning from a flight and hungry).

Reviews.Author: B.
Reviews.Content: im thinking 3 stars for this place.   portions were huge, but nothing that was super delish... server was as expected for the atmosphere of the restaurant... we can keep this one short but sweet... I would return.. but definitely not on my list of a must return.

Reviews.Author: Vegas
Reviews.Content: been coming here for 16 years.  Great food huge portions great staff.   Had a reunion there and all our meals were great had good drinks lots of laughs and they all said they were glad I took them there. One of the last remaining 24 hr cafe's on the strip and with  good prices.

Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: The environment is good but the food is a bit disappointing. The steak is too small for its price. The pasta is really a mass, can't finish even a half.

Reviews.Author: Hesah
Reviews.Content: A group of us [More than 25 people ] were looking for somethings that would accommodate everybody's budget. America's was suggested by one who lived in Las Vegas. The restaurant managed complied with the group , accommodating us in 2 large tables which was nice. We were in the back of the restaurant so we were secluded from the Casino and noise.   The service was a little slow , considering that were served by 3 people servers so the food was coming in a slow pace. However the food was preorder as shared plates , so they knew will ahead of the quantity and type of food.   Food:  Appetizers:  Potato Fries - Garden Salads - Mozzarella fried Cheese.. Fried Chicken wings.. Noting spectacular. I would have expected more from a restaurant hotel. but but looking through the dated decor of the hotel in general and the restaurant in particular , I wasn't excepting much.  Main Dishes: Salmon topped with a slab of Ketchup - Fried spaghetti and Lab chunks -- Again .. Oily and loaded with Salt.. Salmon with Ketchup === Seriously [ Not even a sauce from a can ]   Desserts : Hard as a rock, brownies , Chocolate chip cakes- Cheesecakes  and fried small apple fritters.. Again .. Not Dessert worthy  High Notes: Cheap !!! If you don't want a burger at night, go there, but I can guarantee that you will be more happy and satisfied with a burger from Mcdonalds than eating at this diner.  Low notes: Risk Factor for High Blood Pressure

Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I went for breakfast, and although the servers are perfectly friendly and helpful, the food was lukewarm, overpriced, and far from delicious. Honestly, if you're looking for diner food, you'll do much better at Dennys. I did.

Reviews.Author: Sako
Reviews.Content: No doubt about this place being a 50 star restaurant I love the whole 24 hour everything breakfast by far the best in las Vegas located in the new York new York hotel and casino very friendly staff

Reviews.Author: Dawn
Reviews.Content: We stay at NYNY when we come to Vegas. We have come to see George Strait for years now.  This is how America went above and beyond..  We came down from our room to meet the folks we were going to the George Strait concert with.  We had our hugs as our friends completed their meal.  Off to the concert we go! My husband and I walked this trek to T Mobile Arena earlier in the day to get there fast.  Well..we get to the gate and I realize I may have set our tickets maybe at America..last place we were at and I did indeed take the tickets out of my purse but totally thought I put them back in my purse..umm NO  I go running back the fast way we can as our friends were in line at the venue   I panicky talk to the Supervisor about what happened and literally they went into action! All were gloved up going though the trash in the back area. I had no words for how amazing this staff was!!  A member of their staff clearing tables saw the tickets and set them aside!  I got my tickets and I have to say I LOVE AMERICA AND NYNY!   The staff throughout our stay was awesome! The food was great and I have a fond  place in my heart for them as they go all out to satisfy!!

Reviews.Author: Asuka
Reviews.Content: On our first night getting into town, my buddy and I were pretty exhausted and didn't feel like venturing out to find food on the Strip, so we swung by America after getting out stuff up in the room. Not really too much to look at - typical diner-style restaurant with a lot of American maps and ethos painted on the walls. We came in pretty late when it was empty, so we just slipped onto a couple of the bar stools at the front. The beer selection is pretty standard, but not expensive, and the liquor selection is quite extensive. I ordered your standard breakfast - eggs, bacons, toast, etc. - as a late-night snack, and it came out pretty much as you'd expect. In all - a decent place to grab a bite within NY-NY, but nothing more than that.

Reviews.Author: Michele
Reviews.Content: Don't order the Chinese chicken salad!  Soggy and nasty.  I sent it back and got the Cobb salad instead.  They still charged me for  the salad even though everyone else in my party was halfway done with their food when my salad came.    It took at least 25 minutes for the food to come the first time and then an extra 12 minutes for my replacement salad.  We were hoping that the convenient location in our hotel (NYNY) would provide us with a quick lunch on our way to the outlets for shopping.  That didn't happen.  Slow service and mediocre food.  Come on, New York New York..you can do so much better.

Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is ok. My husband and I stopped in here for dinner before heading to a show. I ordered the macaroni and cheese and was disappointed, ultimately it tasted like Velveeta shells and cheese but the shells were a bit larger. Now don't get me wrong Velveeta shells and cheese is great but I can buy that at my local grocery store for $1.50 where as this plate cost $10.95. I suppose I just expected a little more out of it. My husband ordered the slider trio (which was a fish taco, pulled pork on a biscuit and a beef slider) which he wasn't blown away by either.  PROS: Their decor is cute, they have a giant map of America on the wall that highlights each state with something they are known for, example: Michigan had cars for the motor city.   CONS: There were maybe a dozen people in this restaurant when we went (which didn't even fill a quarter of the tables) yet we had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated. The hostess seemed frazzled so I can't imagine what it would be like if they were actually busy.  TIPS: This city is filled with amazing restaurants, this restaurant is fine, but I personally would not go out of my way to eat here again :/

Reviews.Author: Rhia
Reviews.Content: After leaving Priv√© with my  clubbing buddy , we looked around for a place to grab a bite. Mostly everything was closed, but we eventually settled here. I have no idea why I tend to crave it, especially late at night, but I really wanted toast. I chose the Empire State plate *cues Jay-Z's  Empire State of Mind *, which was basically eggs in whatever style you prefer and sausage or bacon. It also came with toast, so I was content. While waiting for my order to arrive, I proceeded to strike up a conversation with the guy while updating my friends on where I was, checking Facebook/Twitter, etc. Once I looked up, homeboy was totally knocked out. And I thought I had a lot to drink that night. I gave him a good nudge once our food got to the table. A little too good. I nearly toppled over my water. Oy! Anyway, it was a good meal, nothing extravagant. Although I gotta say the bacon was cooked perfectly. I could never cook bacon the way restaurants can for the life of me. Add a star for that.

Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: We went here for breakfast when we first arrived in Vegas. Let me start by saying that the wait staff was extremely nice and attentive to our table. The breakfast is what you typically get at any 24 hour type of diner restaurant, nothing amazing. I ordered an omelet which had no flavor at all but it was a big portion and frankly I was starving after not eating for over 24 hours. My other breakfast mates weren't impressed either but hey we weren't upset about it we kinda figured it wasn't going to blow us away.  I recommend going here if you don't want to spend a lot of money, want big portions and pretty great service. I never tried it for lunch or dinner so I can't comment on that.

Reviews.Author: Barrett
Reviews.Content: Very nice spot. Above average breakfast, especially at very reasonable prices for this neighborhood. Also went to their Super Bowl party and had a good time. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Author: Dylan
Reviews.Content: I usually have breakfast here once a trip.  For a place right on the strip the prices are very reasonable.  Beyond that the food is good and the staff are friendly.

Reviews.Author: Maggie
Reviews.Content: Butterfinger doughnut is amazing. 1 star +  Deco in the restaurant is great. 1star+  We ordered omelette and all you can eat pancake.  Omelette were fine. Especially when you are lazy, it's nice to have someone cook you omelette. Toast with butter I like the taste. Nom.   All you can eat pancake... came 3 in a plate. I shared with sister...and it becomes a single order instead of all you can eat. They said unless we pay double because we cannot share and still have all you can eat. Well if that's the case why didn't you bring it up front when we were ordering ?  Shady  comes up in my mind.   Overall the pancake part is what disappoint us.

Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: This place is a good drunken breakfast stop. Unfortunately we weren't drunk. The food was still decent but nothing to write home about. All around the service and food was a solid average.  The nice thing about the place was that it was so huge so it was good place to meet to start the day for our large group.  Also the donuts are a tasty option.

Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Become an ameriCAN citizen ! What  a great place ! If your a beer drinker and don't mind the CAN this is a must ! Tons of TVs around to watch the games going on and they also have giant Jenga and connect four and if you want they have beer pong  and of course corn hole . They have their own app that keeps track of the beers you have tried there and every 10 beers you get one free. Great atmosphere and the bartenders are really well versed in their beers . Download the app and check this place out. We didn't eat here so my review is just based on the bar it's self and they great time we had here

Reviews.Author: Chantelle
Reviews.Content: How can you complain when you can get a steak and crab legs, salad, and baked potato for $14 in Las Vegas and leave super full? Its not the best quality food but, if you are looking for a filling meal..this is where its at. Shout out to Mono....your girls from VA are coming to see you soon!

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Somewhat frazzled from the hustle bustle and noise of The Strip, America seemed like a quiet oasis, perfect for a recharging lunch.  Midafternoon on a weekday, it wasn't busy and this was just what we needed, even though we didn't feel like a high-priced Vegas lunch bill.    But weekdays from 1130 to 3 they have Daily Specials, two entr√©e choices available for $9.95.  On Thursday the Shrimp and Chips basket was one of the specials, and we both had that.  This was a good deal: lots of fried baby shrimp and fries in a generous size basket, and the quality was pretty good.   A relaxing lunch location with good food and non-Strip prices!

Reviews.Author: Marsh-Silog
Reviews.Content: Convenient and better than some of the shady places in the other hotels.  I liked the crab cakes benedict for breakfast .  Service was kinda on the slow side,

Reviews.Author: Noah
Reviews.Content: Slow service. Water ordered before food, and when food showed up, and the one time the server checked in on us, showed up at the same time as the check. Briosh French toast is made on wonderbread, not Briosh.

Reviews.Author: Luricela
Reviews.Content: We went there during our first trip to Vegas. I had their Mac & Cheese and their Grown Up's Grilled Cheese (yes, it was a deliciously cheesy overload). The mac & cheese was creamy and flavorful. The grilled cheese was made with havarti, cheddar, and pepper jack cheese as well as with apple-wood smoked bacon and flame roasted pasilla peppers all on a telera roll.

Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Their 14.95 rib eye steak late night special hands down blew the $40 steak at a so called steakhouse out of the water. The steak was seasoned perfect, cooked to perfection. Medium rare just how I like it. And thats only talking about 1 meal. We came in here for breakfast because dinner was so good. Breakfast was A+++++. And to top off good food, they had great service. gloria was amazing, funny, attentive and on the money. Keep your high priced fancy restaraunt. Ill spend the money saved on the slots with a full belly.

Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Third time i have been here.  Will never go back.  Was excited to try a cronut.  I was disapointed.  Not much flavor.  Got the Eggs Benedict.  On the plus side the sauce was very good and plenty of it.  The eggs were the most perfectly poached eggs i have ever had.  On the bad side the muffins were burned, the hash browns were tiny and flavorless, and the ham for the Benedict was literally a single slice of deli ham that was thin enough to read through.  The menu stated that Ii was supposed to get toast so i asked for wheat toast which the waitress repeated back but i never got it.  When i asked he about it she said the muffin was the  carb .  I pointed out it was o the menu and she said the menu is a misprint.  The coffee was not good, but they do leave a full carafe of it and offer a to go cup.  The highlight of the dish was a single slice of grilled tomato which was very tasty.  Wish i had just gotten a dozen of those!

Reviews.Author: Nicholas
Reviews.Content: Just checked into our room at New York New York and the wife and I were hungry.  This was the first place we saw, heres how we did....  When we walk up there's a sign of some exotic looking women and the sign said that she was working.  This was quite a draw, this women was stunning.  Although we were there for the food, why not something to look at as well.  We get seated and order some drinks.  After looking at the menu we realized that this place was just a cafe.  And where is this exotic employee?  Nowhere to be found.  BS.  A shit hole of a restaurant and misleading pictures.  I ordered the quesadilla and the lovely wife ordered the wings.  Both tasted like bar food......only worse.  I'm sure glad I had $30 left on a visa gift card otherwise I would've complained about the shit food.  The reason it was 2 stars instead of 1 is because our service was good and I was eating with a beautiful women.....my wife!  Will I again?...  most likely not. Tootles!

Reviews.Author: Alisia
Reviews.Content: Eh nothing special, I was definitely expecting more. I will say that the map inside of the restaurant is pretty impressive, however the food wasn't impressive at all.   Our server was ok, nothing special. Never really came back to ask if we were ok or if we needed anything. The manager came over to us a couple of times to check on us but not the server, we thought that was very odd. The food was ok, nothing to write home about.   Would I return? Probably not, there are other places in New York New York that I would rather go back to.

Reviews.Author: East Bay
Reviews.Content: I can only vouch for their breakfast but it was good.  The eggs and bacon were cooked to order and the whole meal was generally far less greasy than what I've experienced at many diner type restaurants.  The coffee wasn't too bad.  Not horribly overpriced but keep in mind, this is Vegas.  That map is insane.

Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: This place is still delicious. Breakfast runs a little slow but my steak and eggs was worth it. My waiter was super friendly. The only downfall is that it is no longer 24 hours.  The 24 hour place is the burger restaurant that you have to leave the hotel and enter in from the strip.

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Huge portions for the price, but slow. Cocktails are alright. Serves a lot of beer, but their Fat Tire was inoperable when I went.

Reviews.Author: Ashlie
Reviews.Content: I went here because my boyfriend loves the ribeye deal. We went at 12:30am!!! I yelped the America before we got to NYNY and the reviews ranged from horrible to ok?!, egh, With a 3 star yelp rating. My rule is I wIll gIve It a try If rated 3 stars or more, so I was in!. Plus my boyfriend swore by the steak and its seasonings.   At he restaurant,  host greeted us with a smile and we were promptly sat. :-) we already new what we wanted. The rib eye!!! I got mine med/rare with xtra seasoning on the side and baked potato. Our server jaime was friendly, helpful and quick. My steak was cooked perfectly! Sooo good and for only $14!!! Local discount another 10% off. From reading the reviews, seems like you should only go with the steak. I really enjoyed I will be back!!!

Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: 24 hr restaurant! great for get a snack after party. You should be patient at the time you order cause kitchen is really slow!

Reviews.Author: Jacques
Reviews.Content: I really don't need to write a book for this one. It's a reasonably priced (give the location) decent breakfast. If your looking to be wowed, go somewhere else. If your looking for good service and a satisfactory breakfast with basic American fare, than this is your place.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Grabbed breakfast food here.  Hash browns were burnt.  Scrambled eggs were a bit runny and bacon wasn't as crispy.  Mainly didn't like the service at the very end.  We had a flight to catch and needed to leave.  Another server printed out the check for us, and we paid our bill and left it at the table.  The server runs towards us and tells us we don't pay at the front and we have to pay her.  We pointed to the bill with all the cash and said it's there.  When she finally grabs the bill and sees the cash, her tone flips back to being nice.  No, I don't like it when a server thinks we want a free meal.

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: Great food and great service!!! Chris was our waiter and he is amazing. Great place to eat while on vacation!

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Don't go here expecting a lot. It's essentially an I-Hop but it's a decent breakfast for middle-of-the-road prices. I ordered French toast and coffee ad was satisfied.

Reviews.Author: Beatriz
Reviews.Content: Horrible service by Laura. There were only like 3 tables and it was like we weren't even there , she was rude and didn't even care that our orders were wrong. The only good thing was the salad! Thats it!

Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: Over 100 reviews later and this is my first 5* I'm giving for a breakfast place. I went here 4 times during my trip (all for breakfast) and was not let down by anything, not once. By the last day i was looking for something wrong with the place but was hard pressed to find it.   Every day the hostess was nice, even genuinely asked us how our morning was going on the way to the table. Our service was great. Even with our special requests, time constraints and what not. It was near flawless. We were always asked if we wanted a mimosa or bloody Mary even though it was like 8 or 9 am!  Now the food. Oh yea, the food! In the 4 days i went, i had Steak and Eggs, A bagel with lox, omelet with lox and 2 eggs sunny side with bacon.  In general all was well above par and blows any Denny's or IHOP out of the water.   The steak n eggs was about $15 and tasted better then many  dinner  steaks I've had in chain restaurants. The bagel with lox was a tad overpriced at near $11, but was delicious. The omelet with lox was good, but the lox were cooked. I sort of expected it on the side (idk why). it just tasted like a fish omelet to me. Strange but good.   If I'm back in Vegas in this area, I'd eat here again and again.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth
Reviews.Content: Surprise Surprise!  This is the 24 hour behemoth inside New York New York.  These 24 hour diner style establishments I review as if I am forever comparing them to a Denny's.  When I arrived at America I was seated quickly and brought water and coffee quickly, which in Vegas is a great way to start any meal.  Big old carafe of weak coffee is plopped down on your table within a minute of sitting down, and although it isn't the finest quality it makes up for it in quantity.  They have this giant tilted sculpted map of America that hangs precariously over your head as you eat.  I was seated under Texas and this did not make me happy, but examining the map/art thing was a great way to pass the time until my food arrived.  The service was quick and prompt, although the waiter forgot my smoothie on the first trip but realized it himself and was back super quick with it.  My breakfast plater thing had a good amount of mediocre food, that looked like it had actual veggies in it.  Weird.  Also the bacon had some sort of thickness (it was NOT thick bacon), but when you compare it to the bacon at a Denny's it was pretty divine.  I am pretty sure they had some kind of all you can eat buttermilk pancakes for a pretty good price as a special, but a lot of basic pancakes just didn't special to me.  I overheard that this is the food that they serve as room service in New York New York, so hopefully that helps. Things I like : Decor, Lots of coffee, bacon, hash browns, service Things I dislike: Smoothie (tasted watered down and also pricey) in the end these 24 hour places with decent prices are how I usually survive in Vegas for at least part of my time there, and I would return to America when I am dangerously close to extinction.

Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: We rolled into America at close to 4 a.m. hungry after a night of gambling and drinking. All we wanted was some good chow to put us to sleep. The 16 oz. Ribeye Steak for $12.99 was screaming my name and I took the bait. I'm so glad I did. It was a great steak, perfectly cooked medium rare and served with a baked potato and veggies. My two brothers-in-law had the same thing and were also satisfied.

Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: Was here on a Saturday night, at around 9:00 after a day of gaming. We were greeted and seated promptly. The restaurant was clean, not crowded and was a welcome respite from the strip. The wife and I were fairly worn out, very hungry and just wanted a quick bite before heading to our hotel to collapse.  Our friendly server made a few suggestions from the menu, none of them appealed to either of us. We each just wanted something simple, we weren't looking for or expecting a fine dining experience. A nice, juicy hamburger with fries would do the trick.  The orders came out promptly and looked delicious. The fries were hot and crispy but something was definitely not right with the hamburgers. The texture was odd, they had no flavor and after peeling back the bun, no grill marks to show they had ever touched a grill or flat top. I'm 99% certain they were precooked, (maybe even purchased frozen and pre cooked?) then heated in a microwave. The bun LOOKED great but, while not stale, had obviously been around a day or two. We each left 2/3 of our burgers untouched. Paid the bill and left.  Possibly they had an off night, but a decent hamburger isn't hard to do is it? This was our only truly bad dining experience in Vegas during our stay. I see other reviewers have had good experiences here ordering breakfast, maybe that's your best bet.

Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: Stumbled into the America around 4am after a night out which lead to morning at Marquee. I was staying at NYNY so finding a decent place to eat a real meal was key for me and my friend. We were seated right away... Of course, the restaurant was hardly busy. Only a few tables were occupied. Our waiter brought us water right away before we could ask so it was perfect. I'm sure he's seen it hundreds of times... The need to hydrate in Vegas is of the absolute importance. Ha!  I opted for the bagel mania which is a grilled NY style bagel sandwich with bacon, eggs, ham and good ol' american cheese. It was delicious not only cause I was starving at the moment but the combination of ingredients was perfect. The cheese topped off the bacon, eggs and ham. And all those things were encapsulated in a perfectly crisp on the outside, soft on the inside grilled bagel. Delicious... It was just what i needed. It came with country style potatoes. That was pretty good too.  My friend got a rib eye steak and eggs. Loved it and scarfed it like it was the last meal on earth.... Satisfied customer.  Our waiter was real cool. Bill was under $25 with tip. Yes, please... Thank you America, I luh you.

Reviews.Author: Payal
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why people are whining, but I'll jot my two cents down. It was christmas day, late night, we were looking for a 24 hour restaurant to eat at in NY NY, and found this place.  We had the cheese pizza and the vegetable sandwich on rye that came with spiced potato wedges and couple of cocktails. The drinks were great, so was the pizza and the food. The service was impeccable, i mean good food at midnight? with good service? and reasonable prices? and we didn't need to leave the casino to find it..what more do you want? the pizza tastes like east coast pizzeria style which is something we NEVER find in cali....WE LOVED IT. totally worth a checkout.

Reviews.Author: Alys
Reviews.Content: There are a few locales that are referred to as a  city that doesn't sleep , with New York as the likely original, though it has been proven to me over time that few other places can really live up to this claim.  I guess that for my first time back in Las Vegas as an Adult, I assumed that it would be easy as pie (specifically apple pie...read on) to find somewhere half-decent to eat late at night.   After passing many unworthy eating establishments on our 2.5 HOUR trek down the entirety of the strip (complete with a stop to purchase Dr. Scholls shoe inserts after developing blisters), the BF and I reluctantly sat down in a semi-fancy restaurant at the MGM. I took a look at the multicultural, Californian, fusion menu that I would normally exalt in and said,  ...I kind of just want some American food.   BF sighs. We forced our aching feet to carry us across the street to New York, New York, dedicated to a city we should have known we could depend on in the first place, and like a beacon in the night saw this place called flat-out  AMERICA.  Complete with textured map of the United States on the ceiling. If there is a god, she must know what it feels like to NEED a milkshake at 4am.   This is the first time that I have ever paid more for a salad ($14 for southwest-inspired chicken salad) than my BF paid for his steak and potatoes dinner ($12), but I was so happy to get that salad and malt milkshake into my stomach that I didn't mind.   America -- Fuck Yeah.

Reviews.Author: Zerring
Reviews.Content: Went here twice for Breakfast with the family while staying at New York, New York. I felt the breakfast was above par. The eggs were on point and my favorite sourdough toast was fantastic. If they would have screwed up my toast I would have left America. Lol Breakfast was bomb. Viva America

Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness for this restaurant and New York New York for being open so late at night. After going through a hour long food hunt staying at Excalibur and nothing was open to eat at 2 in the morning we were told America was the only restaurant open in the area. After walking and ready to pass out from not eating we were seated and had the best service from James. We told him we were starving and he brought out the food right away. Great service James and not to bad food especially so late at night.

Reviews.Author: Justine
Reviews.Content: Wir waren im Juli 2016 in diesem Restaurant und waren begeistert. So begeistert, dass wir 2 Tage sp√§ter noch einmal dort gegessen haben. Ich kann nur von meinem bzw. unserem Gericht ausgehen (wir hatten beide jeweils Scampi Schrimps auf Tagliatelle in Wei√üwein-So√üe), und das war das beste Gericht dieser Art, dass wir je gegessen haben - da waren wir uns einig! Die Kellner waren zuvorkommend und freundlich, nicht aufdringlich. Das Preis-Leistung-Verh√§ltnis ist vollkommen in Ordnung!

Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: This place was great! Me and my family were looking for a place to eat traditional food for a decent price and this restaurant hidden inside NYNY was perfect.   Our bill for 5 people, came out to be about $60 and we were all so full afterwards. All of the food was cooked perfectly, from omelettes to waffles to eggs, there was a lot of options to choose from too.   Our waitress, Grettel, was super friendly and nice - giving us recommendations and having conversation.   We loved this place!

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Cool decor...favorite place for breakfast when we stay at NYNY! Pancakes are great! Price of meals are decent prices for Vegas....good customer service as well!  I have eaten here on several occasions since I first stayed at NYNY over 10 years ago! I almost always eat here when I visit Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Gustavo
Reviews.Content: Una cafeter√≠a 100 % USA Muy buena carta, excelentes precios y el servicio no tan bueno, pero casi no importa.  Si est√°n hambrientos : Club Sandwich...s√∫per enorme. Antes de las 400 pm hay descuento, as√≠ que vale la pena comer a como estamos acostumbrados en M√©xico. Interesante decoraci√≥n, en la que sobresale el mapa de USA...monumental. Tambi√©n tienen buffet de pancakes (hot cakes) por $7.00  Definitivo, si regreso a Las Vegas, regreso.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: During our stay at New York, New York we decided to have breakfast at America since it looked interesting from walking past. We showed up about the 11 hour and where seated quickly but the service from that point on was pretty slow. I wasn't too impressed by the decor of America, I had heard they had a large scale map of America displayed and it looked more like a geography project my nephew did back in the 5th grade, also wasn't too impressed with the price of breakfast for 3 since the food was just okay.. I was expecting too much from my croissant french toast ( no sides included) and was sadly disappointed.   Side note ( don't get fooled by the  name of the specialty donuts at America, nothing special either)

Reviews.Author: Msdoingmyownhusttle
Reviews.Content: I felt like i was getting rushed out so i had to look around to see how man available tables there were so i turned around and checked it out it was about 20empty seats so not sure why i was being rushed. But oh well next time ill ask!

Reviews.Author: Veronica
Reviews.Content: Came here looking for some inexpensive food and was it was very disappointing. The wait staff and hostess were very nice but the food lacks in taste. We ordered bbq platter and the chicken was engulfed with bbq sauce it was inedible. It was questionable if it was cooked throughly. Left hungry, don't waste your time or money!

Reviews.Author: Lindsay
Reviews.Content: Might as well have just walked across the street to Denny's.  This was really kind of icky.  I ended up getting their fancy oatmeal with maple syrup, soy milk and some dried fruit.  Crazy chewy fruit and when I put the soy milk in my coffee it never mixed - it just sat on top of the drink.  Eew.  j  But if you don't feel like leaving the hotel and need some sustenance, I suppose it would do in a pinch.  Really the only thing it has going for it is the artwork that feels like it could fall on you at any moment!

Reviews.Author: dennis
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is inside NY NY Hotel & Casino..and it's ironic how they can't get my NEW YORK STEAK right.....medium rare please.

Reviews.Author: Kellee
Reviews.Content: Came in for a quick bite with a group of seven. Food and prices were better than expected. Service was decent, but our server seemed overwhelmed. Not a bad choice when you're not interested in waiting or looking for anything specific.

Reviews.Author: Marissa
Reviews.Content: This place fucking sucks don't waste your money even if you're starving. The food is VERY low quality and VERY over priced. Also they only do 4 separate checks which makes it very difficult with large groups in Vegas. Seriously, keep walking.

Reviews.Author: Corey
Reviews.Content: We went here for a late breakfast. I got a sirloin and eggs for breakfast. Partner got pancakes, eggs, hashbrowns, etc. Food was good. Wait service was prompt and attentive to our needs.  When you walk in your see this awesome display of donuts and coffee. Upon being seated you see a full map of the US hanging from the ceiliing. Definitely keeps you occupied while awaiting your food. It is good for kids and big families. Doesn't seem too romantic of a place for a date though.

Reviews.Author: Mari
Reviews.Content: Yet another example of  Check Yelp before eating here ...after waiting thirty minutes to get our food and receiving a bagel sandwich that seemed to have been soaked in grease, I logged on to Yelp to check what others say about the place.  If only I had looked before!  Service was slow (when there was any service), and the food was awful. Do NOT bother with this place.  Walk on by....

Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: Where to start... We had a table for 4. My uncle wanted to have the frosted flakes French toast( reason we came) when we asked about it the waiters simply said I'm new and didn't even ask about it. The GM walked by so we asked her, she did let us know it was removed from the menu. We had 2 orders of country fried steak, an order of new French toast and a breakfast burrito. French toast was mediocre, breakfast burrito was horrible the steak wasn't to bad the eggs that came with both orders were cold as well has the English muffins and toast. We have no reason to come back to this place.

Reviews.Author: Bernard
Reviews.Content: It reminds me somewhat of a Denny's in terms of its menu. What I like best about this place is that it's open 24/7, so if you're looking for a quick bite at 3:00am you can't go wrong here. Their burgers are pretty decent and their entrees are big enough to get me full. The fettucini alfredo was surprisingly good too. There's also a full bar so you're not limited to just beer and wine.The only thing that needs improvement is the wait time. We had to wait at least 20 minutes for our food, which happened on both occassions we ate here.

Reviews.Author: Melisa
Reviews.Content: went to a great wedding earlier in the evening sub-par food. after the sugar high from the cake wore off, my fiance suggested grabbing a little bite to eat. at midnight, the only restaurant open at NYNY was America. had been here many years earlier after an MGM Grand concert and didn't have great memories after it. thankfully it's better now.  we decided to share a cajun chicken sandwich at the waiter's request. I really appreciated that they split the sandwich and fries onto two separate plates. also appreciated that even with the low bill we still got great service.

Reviews.Author: Chomper
Reviews.Content: We came here for breakfast on a sunday but were seated right away. Love the large map of the US on the ceiling. Gave us something to look at since the food did take a bit to arrive. But when it came out the portions were enormous. We ordered 3 plates: steak and eggs, chicken fried steak with eggs, and a regular two eggs with bacon. All orders come with hash browns (yum!), choice of toast, and a petite apple muffin (so cute).  Food was good for what we expected, and prices were decent. Not sure if the steak was ribeye, but it was sooo tender and juicy. The chicken fried steak was perfectly seasoned and hash browns were crispy not greasy. I felt we got our money's worth. Service could've been a bit more attentive, but it was a busy sunday morning in vegas, when many people just want to eat and head out. They had so many varieties of donuts in the front counter that looked delicious, but we were too full to try any. Will definitely come back for breakfast if we're in the area.

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: It was late, as we'd flown in that night.  This seemed safe, in the way that you know you can always find something at a Denny's.  It may not be the best thing you've eaten, but it'll fill you up and you know what to expect.  I'm sad I ate here.  We should've gone to the Irish pub place or something instead.  First off, they pretty much scorched the outside of my  medium  burger, then managed to make the bun into mush.  The vegetable side tasted like someone took canned veggies and boiled the hell out of them.  We barely got service, despite it being dead in there.  Everything was just kind of frustrating.  That said, you might not be bad off if you attempt dessert or breakfast food or something.  Maybe getting something pre-prepped is the way to go.  I say this, because any excuse to sit and look at the giant map sculpture thing for 30 mins. or so is fine if it's not like punishment.  That's the one redeeming factor here.  Seriously, how can you be a bastion of diner style food and jack up a freakin' hamburger?!  That's all I want to know.  ~EEE~

Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: This place is nothing fancy, but doesn't pretend to be. I think foreign visitors and families with children might get a bit more out of the decor and USA trivia on the menu, but the place is designed to be a diner and as such, it fits the bill just fine. The breakfast menu is ordinary (eggs, pancakes, etc), but executed just fine. The service was friendly and efficient. The prices were decent.   In short, good place to get a quick bite, but nothing for a foodie to drool over.

Reviews.Author: Mega
Reviews.Content: Have not had a donut here I didn't like. The latest I tried was the Boston Cr√®me, Apple Fritter and Strawberry Custard Donuts. All were delicious. Bread is soft and fresh. Cream filling is plentiful and satisfying. Not cheap, but fancy donuts in a casino never are.  This cafe is located in NYNY Casino, downstairs near the restrooms, right in front of the America Restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Corina
Reviews.Content: Both times I've eaten here was in the wee hours of like 4-5am. The staff is very helpful and nice, and the food is good. I usually order breakfast. Love that it is open 24 hours and have good prices!

Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: Nice little place. Donuts are yummy and fresh. Coffee is good. They have a deal for a coffee and donut for $4.50. Cashier was really nice.

Reviews.Author: Ro
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to share the breakfast. Had the Belgian waffle, eggs, bacon, and juice definitely worth the $23 bucks. This place has super yummy turkey burgers. My favorite go to place at 3am. Our waitress here were always fast and checked on us constantly. Even with our large group didn't mess up a thing. Try the pi√±a colada here!

Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: On our recent visit to Las Vegas we chose to eat a casual meal at America Restaurant located in New York New York casino. What made our meal so enjoyable was not only the food but the service we received by our server Manny, that we chose to eat there several more times before we left. We don't eat at the high priced restaurants so this option was just perfect. The menu has a variety of choices from  traditional breakfast items to your favorite sandwiches, salads and even some pasta dishes!  Sounds boring but trust me when I say everything we had was outstanding! I am Gluten Free for medical reasons and Manny took the time to explain my options and there were several! They even have Gluten Free bread for the sandwich choices!  He mentioned that he has only been a server for a short time, that he used to be a cook in the kitchen. Wow, what a waste of talent had he stayed in the back of the house. He was so upbeat, professional and a joy to be served by! We will definitely be returning and will ask for him every time. If you are looking for a casual place that is not expensive and has great food options that taste even better, ask for Manny and you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Key
Reviews.Content: let me say that this place rocks when it comes to food and service esp the waitres Tiffini..... we had a HORRIBLE experience at Senor Frogs were starving and just wanted a variety to choose from fresh and good and this is what we got. they lost our ticket and it took a bit long we did not even mention a word but they comped our entire bill and the food was GREAT!

Reviews.Author: Neki
Reviews.Content: Not bad, not good! Reasonable prices. NY skillet was VERY greasy but not bad tasting.  Service is nice. Bloody Mary gets 5 stars...just upgrade the vodka. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: Service was great however the prices did not reflect the quality of the dish. The cocktails we ordered were good. We came here due to the convenience of being open 24 hours. The first time, I ordered a mushroom burger which was good. The second time we went, I ordered a fettuccine pasta, the chicken was overcooked and tasteless. I added so much pepper but that dish was helpless. Unfortunately it was the worst pasta I have had. Went again for the third time, fingers crossed, my Miami press sandwich was overwhelmingly salty. Thank goodness we're leaving today. The restaurants here are horrendous.

Reviews.Author: Lisa Marie
Reviews.Content: We were wandering around into the early morning when we found ourselves at NYNY.  This was open so we decided to check it out. We were seated immediately in the large dining area.  Pam was our server and she was AMAZING ! Despite it being 730 am on the day after Thanksgiving, she was so very welcoming, friendly and helpful. She made our morning and experience one to remember.  We enjoyed a variety of beverages ( double gin ceaser, baileys and coffee, tequila coffee and a baileys and butter ripple shots.  For our meal I had a bagel with cheese, Ham, bacon and egg on it. My husband had the scramble with added bacon and rye toast.   The portions were generous and tasted really great. The service was beyond excellent ! From the hostess to Pam to the food runner to the bus person all the way to the supervisor- all asked how we were and the answer was was always  wonderful  One of the better meals we have had.   We would return for sure!

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYNY several times and on several trips we've thought about eating here but we always end up going somewhere else b/c the prices seem kinda high for what they actually give you. If a side salad cost $7 - seems suspect when I can go to outback and order a real salad for $10.  anyway my bf was hungry and I didnt want the cranky to set in and we didnt want to go any farther than we already had at the hour. We probably couldve driven to Summerlin and been eating before out dinner came out here.   SERVICE: ALARMINGLY SLOW. Couldnt believe it took SOOOO long. We got there around 645. It took over an HOUR to get our food. The place was kinda empty. I ordered a cobb salad and he ordered rice and shrimp. last time I ckd shrimp cooks really fast? so I dont knwo what took an hour other than poor communication.  Theres someone to give you water, theres another person to give you your food, theres a differen person to take your order. We saw the water girl way more than we saw our server, which at this point we decided they jsut forgot to turn in the order and that must be why it took that long. the table in front of us had more people, sat down after us and ate and left and we still had yet to take our first bite. sad.   FOOD: the plate was ok, not anythign I'd order again. THe bacon was good and crunchy which I like but oh so greasy. . to the point it made me sick. i wasnt alone... my bf felt fine till I gave him a bite of the bacon oops I mean grease with bacon. ah .. lets put it this way. the food @ Hard Rock Cafe was way better and we all know they arent known for great cuisine.   would I come back? no I would not. Its a 24 hr place but so is walmart and mcdonald's.

Reviews.Author: F
Reviews.Content: We stopped in here to pick up much raved about Cronus. They're a cross between donut and croissant. This place offers different toppings like honey glaze, sugar, chocolate, and Butterfinger. We got two honey glazed cronuts and put a little bit of cinnamon on the second one. Both were good but so very sticky and messy. Worth trying once but that's about it.

Reviews.Author: Anita
Reviews.Content: Worst service ever!!!  The food was only good because we had to wait 45 mins and were starving on a slow morning with lots of staff walking around. We had a food allergy which I understand is not something I expect businesses to always be able to work with but it was CLEARLY stated on the menu that there were tons of GF options and the waiter couldn't even answer the simple questions about the food. Waiters and waitresses should at the very least be aware of the menu!!!!! I know not to expect a lot when dining out but this place was a joke. They even tried to argue with us about the amount of time it took to get our food. We had proof! The waiter continued to ignore us and avoided eye contact until we begged for the bill. If you hate your job don't work there!!!

Reviews.Author: Ululani
Reviews.Content: Very cute place. I love the hanging USA map thing. It makes the place look festive. The food was good and well portions. I got the chocolate chip pancakes and it was too much to finish. Service was great, no complains. :)

Reviews.Author: Jordyn
Reviews.Content: The doughnuts are great, but I was not super impressed with the restaurant food. I had the French toast and it was extremely soggy- even after sending it back once. The scramble was just ok. I would come back for the pastries but not the other food.

Reviews.Author: Gimena
Reviews.Content: We went to America because it was recommended by one of those   Las Vegas with kids  pages. Don't go. Bad. Really bad! It was dirty, smelled like dirty wet rags, the servers were all over the place. They messed up my Hamburguer twice, served my kid cold Mac n cheese.  Seriously, bad!

Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: Ugh.  The story that I can tell that sums this place up involves a group of us guys roaming in here at 6a (having been up the entire night) and in desperate need of food. They had an  all you can eat  pancake special going on, which at the time sounded fantastic. And then we got the pancakes - these were the driest things ever put together - more absorbent than a Sham-Wow. No amount of fake maple syrup could make these things palatable, which in our state is saying something.   Terrible food. About the only thing that I've found on the menu that's any good is the bagel sandwich.  (If you're wondering why I've gone back, well, it's the only 24-hour restaurant in the NYNY Casino, and sometimes convenience just wins out)

Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: Don't eat at this place. The decor and service was great but not enough to make up for the horrible food! Don't, and I mean don't order the country fried steak and eggs !! I only ate one bite and that was enough. Even the water left a bad taste in your mouth. Waste of time and money. Don't come here.

Reviews.Author: Jessie
Reviews.Content: Awesome food and great customer service. Friendly atmosphere. Our ribeye steak dinner and chicken fettuccine was delicious.

Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: Chris the bartender is amazing... He is very attentive and takes care of you... I will always recommend him and this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Manny
Reviews.Content: I ordered fish and chips and I have to say the food SUCKED. the fish was terrible and the cole slaw had no flavor.

Reviews.Author: Ivy
Reviews.Content: I don't know what happened to this place over the years but it was quite a disappointment coming back here recently and seeing the change.
